Vilma tiene 51 años de edad, esta acompañada y es madre de 4 hijos. Vive con su compañero de vida, una hija de 26 años de edad y  un hijo de 22 años y dos nietos.

Actualmente, administra una tienda en su casa desde hace 6 años, antes compraba ropa en cantidades considerables y se trasladaba en buses a comunidades donde les vendía a tiendas por docenas. Esta actividad la dejo de hacer debido al repunte delincuencial en la zona oriental del país. Por lo que, su compañero le impidió trabajar de esta forma y así fue como establecieron una pequeña tienda en la vivienda.

Los productos que comercializa los obtiene en el mercado municipal, el que se encuentra a unos 5 kilómetros de su casa y otros como las bebidas gaseosas y refrescos le llevan los distribuidores hasta su casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar ropa para todas las edades y regresar a vender  como lo hizo antes, considera que los clientes los tiene por que logro establecer amistad con ellos y siempre le llaman para que les abastezca de mercadería. Esto considera que logro por la  buena atención y comprensión que siempre les tuvo.

La necesidad principal es la de abastecer con capital de trabajo para que inicie con un negocio que realizo durante 20 años.

Sus planes es, establecerse con su negocio de venta de ropa; siempre, mantener la tienda y trabajar para comprar un terreno para que sus hijos puedan construir sus viviendas.
texts.en:
Vilma, age 51, is in a relationship and has four children.  She lives with her life partner, her 26 year old daughter, her 22 year old son, and two grandchildren.

She now runs a store, which she has had for six years, in her house.  Before that she bought considerable quantities of clothes and went by bus to communities where she sold them by the dozen to stores.  She left this business activity because of the increase in crime in the eastern part of the country.  Consequently, her life partner stopped her from working this way.  That is how they established a small store at home.

She gets the products that she sells at the municipal market.  It is five kilometers from her house.  Others, like carbonated drinks and soft drinks, the distributors bring to her house.

The loan that she is requesting from the Fundación Campo is to buy clothes for all ages and to start selling like she did before.  She thinks that she has the customers because she managed to establish a friendship with them.  They always call upon her to stock them with merchandise.  She believes that she managed to do this because of the good attention and understanding that she always had for them.

Her main need is to have working capital in order to start with a business that she had for 20 years.  Her plans are to establish her business of selling clothes, to always maintain the store, and to work to buy a piece of land where her children will be able to build their houses.

loans.use: to buy clothes for all ages and to start selling like she did before.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is 32 years old. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by trade. For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to their lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. 

Therefore Nazia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing their rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Nazia is very much thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing their rickshaw.

loans.name: Kubra's Group

texts.en: Kubra is a 38-year-old married woman. She is the mother of three children. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband started his own business in spare parts eight years ago. Kubra, a member of a two-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use the loan to increase his supply of spare parts of motorbikes to sell so that he can respond quickly to customers' needs. He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. Kubra hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Tea

texts.en:
Tea is a 30-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband, Gocha, and two daughters (11-year-old Mariam and 8-year-old Nino) in Sagarejo district, Kakheti Region. Gocha trades in wood seasonally. This is the only source of income for their family, which is not enough to make ends meet for a family of four. In the region there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make living. 

So, Tea decided to start a farming business with a loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers.  Tea’s credit requests were rejected several times, as she doesn’t satisfy their requirements. 

She received the credit in the framework of a joint initiative, the Kiva and Credo Start-up Program, which gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.  

With the loan of 4,000 GEL, she will purchase three milking cows and feed for them. After buying milking cows, Tea will milk them and start producing dairy products for selling. 

The start-up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased thanks to Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: to purchase three milking cows and feed for them.

loans.name: Asiya

texts.en:
Asiya is 31 years old and a housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children. She belongs to a poor family. She is facing many hurdles to support the life of her family.

Her husband is the only income-earning person in the family. He is a tailor by profession. He has excellent tailoring skills. His customers appreciate his work. He needs to purchase one more sewing machine, to enable him to complete the orders of customers on time. By purchasing one more machine, he will be able to satisfy his customers more efficiently. Therefore his wife, Asiya, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. She will use the loan to help her husband, by buying the sewing machine he needs. She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakiatan.

loans.use: to purchase one more sewing machine for her husband's tailoring business

loans.name: Maisom's Group

texts.en:
Maisom lives in a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district, in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is 45 years old and married. She has five children, three of whom are still in school in the local area. To support her family, she has been growing rice, cassava and rubber trees. The current business earns her about 29,000 KHR per day, and she can save 15,000 KHR each day, after living expenses.

Maisom is just on her first loan from VisionFund. Now she is leading her group of two, to apply for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR, each. Maisom, who is the leader, will use her portion of the loan money to buy fertilizer for her plantation. With this loan, she hopes to make more healthy rice, to increase her family’s income and make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crops

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Julio César

texts.es:
Julio tiene 62 años de edad, vive junto a su compañera de vida que se dedica a la sastrería y  con quien convive desde hace 35 años, y procrearon 4 hijos, de los que solo vive con ellos una hija de 30 años de edad.


Él Se dedica a trabajar como albañil desde hace mas de 30 años, este oficio lo aprendió con un tío que lo apoyo cuando fue joven y en lo que se refiere al cultivo de maíz y maicillo lo hace desde que era muy pequeño, sus padres se dedicaban y dependían de estos cultivos.

Las materias  primas las adquiere en la ciudad y se desplaza aproximadamente 10 kilómetros en autobuses  que hacen este recorrido. 


El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para pagar $100.00 en alquiler de la tierra, $250.00 en compra de fertilizantes e insecticidas, $150.00 en la mano de obra para cultivar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maicillo. La cosecha será comercializa con  ganaderos de la zona que hacen ensilajes.


A través del préstamo, se fortalecerá con capital de trabajo a la familia para que realice el cultivo que han hecho desde hace 8 años y que no les dejara quedar mal con sus clientes.


Desea, Seguir trabajando,  hacer mejoras a la vivienda; es decir, ampliar su vivienda para que sus hijos puedan vivir con mejor comodidad.
texts.en:
Julio is 62 years old and lives with his wife and one of their four grown children. Julio's wife makes a living as a seamstress, and Julio works as a mason. He has over 30 years experience working as a mason, and he learned the trade while working with and helping his uncle. In addition to masonry, Julio also learned many farming techniques at a young age from his uncle, including tactics for tending corn and sorghum crops. His parents also worked in agriculture and depended on their crops for their livelihood.

Julio buys his raw materials in a nearby city 10 kilometers from his town. With the support from this loan, Julio plans to put $100.00 toward renting arable land, $250.00 toward the purchase of fertilizers and insecticides, and $150.00 towards covering labor costs for planting and tending 14 square meters of sorghum crops. Once harvested, he plans to sell his crops to local grain exporters who can store large quantities in silos.

With this loan, Julio hopes to strengthen his farming operation and build on his great reputation as a successful farmer for the past eight years. Julio wants to continue working and farming, and he also hopes to make some improvements to add onto his house so that his family can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to rent arable land, purchase fertilizers and insecticides and cover labor costs of planting and tending 14 square meters of sorghum crops.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 64-year-old married man and a father to two sons and four daughters. Mohammad has a pension salary as a source of income.  He was a worker and received a low salary so his income doesn’t cover all his required expenses. He is living in an uncompleted house in Jenin. Mohammad and his family live in a home that is not suitable to live in. Mohammad is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing necessary materials to fix his house. This will enable Mohammad and his family to enjoy living in suitable home conditions. Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the costs of painting the family house

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.es: Cipriana, de 48 años, es una mujer fuerte y muy trabajadora. Es viuda hace 16 años y desde ese entonces cuidó de sus 6 hijos de los cuales solo vive con 2 de ellos en su casa propia. Actualmente posee extensas áreas de terreno en su comunidad y gracias a su esfuerzo en la agricultura, actividad que desarrolla desde muy niña, logró adquirir el soporte económico para criar a sus hijos. Siembra zapallo, maíz y papa , además de frutas como manzana, chirimoya y algunos cítricos. “Realizo cualquier actividad agrícola para obtener el dinero necesario”, comenta. Tiene más de 20 años en la agricultura, toda su experiencia lo obtuvo gracias a sus padres y abuelos quienes también fueron agricultores. Ahora se encuentra en la cosecha de maíz y la preparación de la tierra para la siembra de zapallo, “estoy trabajando sin parar, contratando trabajadores para que me ayuden, estoy segura que esta temporada será buena”, afirma. Este es el segundo crédito con KIVA, y se siente feliz por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Cipriana, invertirá los S/.2000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Cipriana, age 48, is a strong and very hard-working woman. Since becoming a widow 16 years ago, she has been caring for her six children, only two of whom live with her now in her own home. She has extensive lands in her community, and thanks to her hard work as a farmer (a job she learned at a very young age) she has been able to bring in an income to support her children. She plants pumpkin, corn, and potato, as well as fruits such as apples, custard apples, and some citric fruits. "I have done every kind of agricultural activity in order to make the necessary income", she says.
She has worked in agriculture for over 20 years. Her parents and grandparents taught her everything she knows; they were also farmers. Cipriana is currently harvesting corn and preparing the land for sowing pumpkin. "I am working without stop, hiring workers to help me. I am sure that this season will be good", she tells us. This is her second loan on Kiva, and she is happy to have this financial support to move forward. She promises to be punctual in repaying her quotas. Cipriana will invest the 2000 soles in the purchase of organic fertilizer to nourish her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Adham

texts.en:
Adham is a 28-year-old married man. He is a father to one son. He is living in Gaza with his family in a very humble house. Adham is a worker and receives a low salary which is not enough to cover all the family's needs. 

Adham is a successful man. For the past two years, Adham has been selling and repairing electrical equipment, which has been a profitable project. This project is the only source of income for his family. However, his business also needs more support to get bigger and make improvements. 

Adham is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing more electrical products for the project. This will increase the working capital and the size of inventory of the project and increase sales in order to improve the family's income. Adham is pictured next to his shop.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for his store to resell

loans.name: Honorio

texts.es: Honorio, de 45 años, es un hombre trabajador. Vive en compañía de su esposa Hortensia y sus 2 hijos a los que quiere mucho y cuida en la casa que le heredó su madre hace dos años. Desde niño aprendió a tejer a base de lana de alpaca y vicuña, pues gusta mucho de hilar y trabajar en su maquina artesanal. Tiene años de experiencia en la artesanía, su trabajo y buen gusto le ayudaron a poseer clientes fijos, comenta que los meses de mayor venta son de enero a septiembre, por esto desea seguir tejiendo en abundancia y necesita comprar lanas de calidad al por mayor y así abastecer su negocio. Espera poder compra varios kilos de lana procesada y así seguir con el arte que le apasiona. Este es su segundo crédito con KIVA, por lo que agradece el apoyo económico que le brindan, pues de esa manera seguirá con sus proyectos de mejora para su negocio. Asimismo promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Honorio, invertirá los S/.1500 en la compra de lanas de diferentes colores para realizar sus textiles.
texts.en:
Honorio, 45 years old, is a hardworking man.  He lives in the company of his wife Hortensia and his 2 children who he loves very much and takes care of in the house that he inherited from his mother two years ago.  He learned to weave as a child using the wool of alpaca and vicuña.  He likes very much to spin and work on his artisanal loom.  He has years of experience in the craft, his work and good taste helped him to have regular customers.  He says that the months with the greatest sales are from January to September.  That's why he wants to continue weaving in abundance and needs to purchase quality wool at wholesale and thus supply his business.  He hopes to be able to purchase several kilos of processed wool and thus continue with the art that he is passionate about.  

This is his second loan with Kiva and he is grateful for the economic support that it provides him since in this way he will continue with his improvement projects for his business.  He also promises to be punctual with the payment of his installments.  Honorio will invest the 1,500 soles (PEN) in the purchase of wools in different colors to make his textiles.

loans.use: to purchase wool in different colors.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled is a 19-year-old single man from Nablus. He has his own business which is selling clothes. His business somehow earns a good income but not enough. Khaled is living in a very humble house with his family.  He is looking to improve his house by building an additional room, He does not have enough money for this, so he needs a loan of $1,500 USD from FATEN. His separated room will be an improvement and Khaled will live in it and have some much needed privacy. He is pictured in front of his home.

loans.use: to pay the costs of building another room

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is from Caluya, Sapangdalaga Misamis Occidental and is married with four children. Their main source of income is farming. They grow and harvest coconut and banana to make a living. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy fertilizer such as manure. She hopes to gain more income in order to save for the future of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Filipina

texts.en: From the town of Ubay, Bohol. Filipina works with her husband on their farm, which is their sole source of income. She is requesting a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides. With this, they will be able to improve their farm as well as their harvest.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
This is Nora, 40, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Alejo, an employee, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Nora operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. She also sells banana cue (deep fried bananas coated in caramelized brown sugar) for additional income Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php 9,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Nora hopes to expand her business and dreams of giving her children a good life and education.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Vioinda

texts.en:
This is Violinda, 55, resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Felotio, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Violinda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling at retail.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

She is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Violinda hopes to expand her business and dreams of having a house and lot in a subdivision.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business

loans.name: Rizalyn

texts.en:
This is Rizalyn, 39, resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Alberto, a side car boy, and is the mother to one child. She together with her husband manage their household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rizalyn operates the buy and sell business of her family. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers, and sells them for a little profit. Her products are women’s clothes and other products. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy ready to wear (RTW) products and merchandise items like women’s clothing to expand her product inventory.

Rizalyn hopes to become a successful business woman and dreams to give her child a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for ready to wear products mostly children's wear needed in her business

loans.name: Germa

texts.en:
Germa runs a 'sari-sari' or variety store business in her place in Ubay, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of seven children.

Germa sells various goods and items like foods and dry goods to the people in her neighborhood. As of now, Germa needs a loan for the expansion of her business. She is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, eggs, snack foods, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to improve her stock and attract more buyers, thus augmenting her sales and income.

Germa has hopes of making her business a success and a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, eggs, snack foods, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
This is Maribel, 34, resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Rene, 47,  her business partner, and is a mother to her children. While attending to her family needs, she also keeps herself busy with her business as her way of helping her husband in sustaining daily expenses.

Maribel is in the manufacturing business. She makes foam beds together with her husband. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 30,000 PhilippinePesos (PHP) in sales weekly.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 12,000 PHP loans. She will be utilizing the loan to buy materials needed in making foam beds like foam, rugby, textile and plastic. Her earnings would be a big help for the education of her children and future expenditures.   

Maribel dreams that her children will be able to finish their studies and have a good job someday. She wants to have a better life for her family to enjoy. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as it strengthens her faith in Christ.  

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. Afellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for materials needed in making a foam bed like foam, rugby, textile and plastic

loans.name: Magela

texts.en: Magela, who is married, works hard to support her family selling dry goods in the Philippines. In business for 15 years now, she is requesting a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more dry goods such as slippers, bags, pants, etc. In the future, Magela would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more dry goods such as slippers, bags, pants and other items.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 46 years old, married, and has eleven children; four children are currently in school, Merlita works very hard to provide for them.

Merlita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Merlita has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, soft-drinks, candies, noodles, bread and other groceries. 

Merlita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 58 years old, married and has 5 children. 

Delia is in the agricultural business, farming sugar cane in the Philippines. Delia requested a 25,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Delia has been farming sugar cane for 13 years now, and has borrowed eleven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Delia would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 57 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. Norma works very hard to provide for them.

Norma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Norma has been in this business for 19 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, snack foods, purified water and other groceries. 

In the future Norma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rossini

texts.en:
Rossini works hard to support her family. Rossini earns a living by selling dry goods in the Philippines.

Rossini requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more dry goods to sell. She has been in this business for 22 years.

In the future, Rossini would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 32 years old, married, and has five children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Rowena is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rowena has been farming vegetables for 15 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling dry goods and vegetables.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is 50 years old and married..

Esperanza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Esperanza has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from farming sugar cane.

Esperanza aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Florence Joy

texts.en:
Florence Joy is 34 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Florence Joy has a restaurant business in the Philippines. Florence Joy requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant.

Florence Joy has been in this business for five years. In the future, Florence Joy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Solange

texts.en: Solange is 24 years old. She owns a general store and has been in the business for the past eighteen years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar, maize flour and cooking oil for resale. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, maize flour and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is 47 years old, married and has 3 children, one of whom is in school. 

Judy is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Judy requested a 27,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Judy has been raising pigs for 22 years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Judy would like to repair and renovate her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en: Ruby is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice farming business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies for her rice farming business. Ruby has been in this business for 10 years. Ruby earns more income from raising pigs. Ruby has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 54 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Magdalena has a business selling dry goods in the Philippines. Magdalena requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items such as bags, pants, shoes and school supplies.

Magdalena has been in this business for 35 years. In the future, Magdalena would like to save enough money to provide financial security for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as bags, pants, shoes and school supplies

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha works hard to support her family. Editha is married and has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. Editha requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to resell. Editha has been in this business for two years now. In the future, Editha would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Ramatu from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married and has 5 children. She began this business because she wants to stop sitting at home as a housewife and create a source of income to support the home.

Ramatu runs a general stock; she sells drinks, cigarettes, biscuits and soap. She has been running this business for 20 years. She works at the business every day, from morning to night.  She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Ramatu has requested a loan in order to purchase items such as drinks, cigarettes, biscuits and soap. The extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and improve her standard of living. In the future, she plans to open a shop. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase items such as drinks, cigarettes, biscuits and soap

loans.name: Viannette

texts.en: Viannette is 32 years old. She sells clothes and has been in the business for the past two years.  With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes for resale. The profits from the business will be used for savings. She is very happy with the loan she has requested.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Eliseo Fermín

texts.es:
Eliseo tiene 31 años de edad, Vive junto a su compañera de vida de 39 años de edad y se dedica a la comercialización de productos cosméticos y ropa, esto lo hace en las comunidades aledañas y en la que residen. Han procreado un hijo de 8 años que estudia el segundo grado.


Se dedica a trabajar como ayudante de albañil desde hace mas de 10 años y al  cultivo de maíz en áreas de hasta 7,000 metros cuadrados donde obtiene rendimientos de hasta 40 quintales con maíz criollo.

Las materias  primas las adquiere en la ciudad y se desplaza aproximadamente 5 kilómetros en los que paga un pick up,  para hacer la compra  se asocia con sus hermanos con el objetivo de bajar el costo de transporte.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para pagar  un terreno. Este lo vendió al crédito a una prima desde hace 8 años, recibió $1,000.00 con la promesa que ella le pagaría por cuotas, lo que no cumplió debido a que enfermo. Por lo que llegaron al acuerdo que él regresara el dinero con el que fijaron el trato de compra, considerando que no le podrán seguir pagando por el problema de salud.


Con la compra del terreno, tendrá un lugar donde construir su propia vivienda, hoy vive en casa de un hermano.


Él piensa construir su vivienda a futuro e instalar una tienda.
texts.en:
Eliseo is 31 years old and lives with his life partner who is 39 years old. His business is selling clothing and cosmetics which he does in the community they live in as well as the surrounding communities They have an 8 year old son who is studying in Grade Two.

Eliseo has worked as a bricklayer's assistant for more than 10 years and cultivates corn on as much as 7000 square meters harvesting up to 40 quintals of Creole corn. He along with his brothers travel about 5 kms to the city to buy raw materials in a rented pick-up in order to reduce their transportation costs.  

The loan he is asking Fundacion Campo for is to buy a plot of land. Eliseo sold this plot to a cousin 8 years ago for $1000 on the promise that she would pay by installments. She got sick and could not make her payments. So they came to an agreement that Eliseo would return the money paid when they made the deal back to her, as she cannot pay due to health problems.

Eliseo will then have a place to build his own home. Right now they live a house that belongs to one of his brothers. He plans to build his home and in the future open a store in it.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Maa Durga Group

texts.en:
This Joint Liability Group named Maa Durga was formed in the year 2010 by six active women entrepreneurs of the village Naren of Balangir district of Odisha, India. Tai is one of them. She is raising her hand in the photograph. She is a married woman of 39 and is the mother of four daughters aged ten, six, four and one year old. Together with her husband, Tai manages their household while operating the business. Presently she is working hard to continuously to provide income for their day-to-day expenses. 

Tai operates a vegetable farm with her husband. She grows vegetables like 'brinjal', cauliflower, carrot, cabbage, chilis, ladies' fingers, etc. in their farm located in the same village. She sells her produce wholesale to the traders of the nearby market as well as to the local community. She earns a minimum of 200 INR per day which makes it very difficult to manage her family. So Tai wants to increase her business by expanding the volume of her business. Tai will utilize the present loan for buying fertilizer and farm inputs like seeds and pesticides. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. Tai has a dream to give her whole family a good future through her hard work. She also dreams of constructing a house and giving a better education to her daughters.  

The five co-members of her group  Dibya, Banita, Khitisuta, Ahalya and Nirmati are successfully running a barber shop, shoe store, tailoring center, puffed rice vending and general store businesses respectively.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing fertilizer, seeds and pesticides.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet 44-year-old Kadiatu from Waterloo, Eastern area, in Freetown. She is married with two children, ages 2 and 20 years old. She began her business because she wanted to create income to support her children and herself. In 2000, Kadiatu established her general stock business. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m., Monday to Friday. She says that the main challenges in her business are price inflation and transportation difficulties.

Kadiatu requires a loan in order to purchase more items, such as cigarettes, bags of rice, soft drinks and milk. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her child and buy a piece of land. In the future, Kadiatu plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items, such as cigarettes, bags of rice, soft drinks and milk, for her store.

loans.name: Dila

texts.en:
Dila lives in a very rural village in the northern part of the country where other people there are mostly focused on livestock because the terrain helps this type of activity. Yet, Dila has chosen another way of making a living, that of agriculture, in addition to livestock. She started planting olive trees some twelve years back and this is where her focus has been throughout these years. 

“I sell olives to locals who want to pickle them or make olive oil and I also sell homemade dairy products and raw milk. This way I keep myself busy everyday and all day," she said laughing. 

Dila is in her fifties, married and has two children. She is requesting a loan through lenders in order to build a fence around the olive plantation.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a fence around the olive plantation

loans.name: Amparo

texts.es: Amparo, de 27 años es una mujer honesta y trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Jorge y su única hija en la casa que compró hace dos años. Amparo se dedica a la ganadería por está razón todas las mañanas se dirige a sus extensas áreas en donde siembra alfalfa, pues necesita de estos pastos para poder cuidar de sus vacas, comenta que lleva 7 años dedicándose a esta labor y le gusta mucho vivir en el campo, “Los días son tranquilos y puedo cuidar más de mis animales”, afirma. Posee 3 vacas lecheras en producción, con 3 terneras, las que se encuentran en proceso de crecimiento. Todos los días gracias a la producción de leche elabora un promedio de 14 moldes de queso, las que comercializa a los compradores de productos lácteos todos los días. Como buena mujer del campo confiesa que también le gusta sembrar alimentos como maíz, habas y papa, el cual lo utiliza para su propio consumo. Este es su segundo préstamo con KIVA, por lo que agradece el apoyo que recibe para segruir adelante, además se compromete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Amparo invertirá los S/.2000 soles en la compra de una vaca para así aumentar su reproducción de leche.
texts.en:
Amparo is 27 years old; she is an honest and hardworking woman. She lives together with her husband Jorge and their only daughter in a house that she bought two years ago. 

Amparo earns her living in livestock, so every morning she heads to the extensive areas where she farms alfalfa, as she needs that grass to be able to take care of her cows. She says that she has been doing this work for seven years and that she really likes living in the country. "The days are peaceful, and I can better take care of my animals," she states. 

She has three milk cows in production, with three heifers that are still in the process of growing. Every day, thanks to the production of milk, she makes an average of 14 cheese molds that she sells every day to dairy product buyers. Like a good country woman, she confesses that she also likes to grow food like corn, broad beans, and potatoes, which she uses for her own consumption. 

This is her second loan with Kiva, so she is grateful for the support that she is receiving to continue making progress. In addition, she promises to be punctual with her loan repayments. 

Amparo will invest the 3,000 soles [PEN] in the purchase of a cow so that she can increase milk production.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Sabina Paulina

texts.es: Sabina vive junto con su familia en la hermosa ciudad de Paucartambo en el departamento del Cusco, ella tiene 44 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene tres hijos a quienes saca adelante, ella alterna las actividades del hogar con la venta golosinas, galletas, gaseosas, chicles, tortas. Ya son varios años que se dedica a  este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Carmen” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo dulces y galletas para incrementar el capital del negocio. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Sabina lives together with her family in the beautiful city of Paucartambo in the department of Cusco. She is 44 years old and married. Thanks to this beautiful relationship, she has three children whom she puts first. Sabina alternates between her home activities and selling candies, cookies, sodas, gum, and cakes. She has already been working in this business for many years, and it is going very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work. Sabina belongs to the communal bank “Mamacha Carmen,” and at this time she needs the loan to buy merchandise, such as sweets and cookies to increase her business's income. Sabina is grateful and values the loan, and she promises to make her monthly payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as sweets and cookies.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto, de 63 años es un hombre responsable. Vive en compañía de su esposa y su pequeña hija en su casa propia. Desde hace 4 años, el principal ingreso económico de Roberto, es la compra y venta de frutas en cantidad y al por mayor, su trabajo consiste en comprar las cosechas de los agricultores para comercializarlos al por mayor a los comerciantes que llegan a su casa, donde posee un pequeño almacén, alli junta las cajas de frutas. Este es su primer préstamo con KIVA y se siente agradecido por el apoyo finanaciero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Roberto, invertirá el dinero en la compra de cajas de frutas tales como naranja, mandarina, entre otros.
texts.en:
Roberto is a responsible 63-year-old man. He lives with his spouse and their young daughter in their own house. For the past 4 years, Roberto's main economic income has been from buying and selling fruits wholesale and in bulk. His job consists of buying the farmers' harvests to sell them wholesale to the merchants that come to his house. He has a small store in his house where he puts together the boxes of fruit. This is his first loan with KIVA, and he feels grateful for the financial help that he receives to get ahead. He also promises to make his monthly payments on time.

Roberto will invest the money in buying boxes of fruit such as oranges and tangerines, among others.

loans.use: to buy fruits such as oranges and tangerines, among others.

loans.name: Cornelio

texts.es: Cornelio nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo en el departamento del Cusco y vive junto con su familia en esta hermosa ciudad, él tiene 52 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene siete hijos a quienes saca adelante, él se dedica a la venta de carne de corderos, vacuno, porcino, pollo, pescado y res, él tiene un pequeño puesto de venta en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Paucartambo donde expende sus productos y el puesto de venta esta implementado con la necesidad básicas, él administra su negocio y a tiende a sus clientes con mucha amabilidad y cortesía por ese motivo siempre regresan a comprar al puesto de venta. Ya son varios años que se dedica a  este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, él pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Carmen” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar carne. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Cornelio was born in the city of Paucartambo in the department of Cusco and lives with his family in this beautiful city.  He is 52 years old and in a common-law marriage from which he has seven children he supports.  He makes a living selling lamb, beef, pork, chicken, fish, and other meats.  He has a small sales stall in one of the markets of the city of Paucartambo where he sells his products and the stall is implemented with the basic necessities.  He manages his business and tends to his customers with a lot of kindness and courtesy and for that reason they always come back to buy at his stall.  He has been in this business for several years and it is going very well for him thanks to the effort that he puts into his work.  

He belongs to the communal bank “Mamacha Carmen” and on this occasion he needs the loan to purchase meat.  He is grateful for and values the loan and he is committed to making his monthly payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to purchase meat.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en: Margarita is a 53-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has seven children. Her youngest child is 20 years old. She runs a sari-sari (retail store) business. She sells biscuits, cooking oil, sugar, coffee, canned goods, soaps and shampoos. She has been operating a retail store for more than ten years. She requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy various goods like condiments, beverages and soaps. In the future, Margarita would like to expand her sari-sari store in order to provide her family with good living conditions and a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy various goods like condiments, beverages and soaps

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a merchant from the town of Ubay, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her area. The retail store is her source of income.

Luzviminda is asking for a loan to buy more groceries for her store like chips and snack foods, canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to improve her store and attract more buyers thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more groceries for her store like chips and snack foods, canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Sabreen

texts.en:
Sabreen is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo. The picture was taken in the store where he purchases the laptop. 

Sabreen is a 22-year-old married woman. She is a mother of one son. Her husband is a goods transporter with a very low income that barely covers the family's needs, so they both live in a very humble house in Jabalia. She is requesting a 500 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. This will help Sabreen to do her homework and reports and help her to do her studies more easily. This will ensure a better future for Sabreen and improve the family's living conditions. Sabreen's husband is photographed at the store where he purchases the laptop.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies

loans.name: Moussa

texts.en: Moussa is a 31-year-old single man living in a small village in the Bekaa valley of Lebanon. He is a car mechanic and owns a business where he maintains trucks, cars, etc. He decided to contact Al Majmoua and acquire a loan in order to purchase materials for construction. In fact, he wishes to maintain and enhance the living environment in his house in order to be ready to finally settle down and establish a family. As for the future, Moussa wishes to expand his business, as well as launch a second business that would be equipped with highly technical tools.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to maintain and enhance the living environment in his house in order to be ready to finally settle down and establish a family

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
This is Rosario, 69, resident of Caloocan 5, Philippines. She is married to Renato, a construction worker, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rosario operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo,  PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 17,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Rosario hopes to expand and grow her business.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and  also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Osiel

texts.es: Osiel nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo en el departamento del Cusco y vive junto con su familia en esta hermosa ciudad, él tiene 30 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos a quienes saca adelante, él se dedica a la venta de materiales de construcción como por ejemplo cemento, yeso, piedra, arena y etc. Ya son varios años que se dedica a  este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, él pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Carmen” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como cemento, arena, piedra chancada y yeso. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Osiel was born in the city of Paucartambo in the department of Cusco, and he lives together with his family in this beautiful city. He is 30 years old and has a common-law relationship from which he has two children who he puts first. Osiel sells construction materials, such as cement, plaster, stone, and sand, among others. He has already been working in this business for many years, and it is going well thanks to the effort that he puts into his work. Osiel belongs to the communal bank “Mamacha Carmen,” and at this time he needs a loan to buy materials, such as cement, sand, crushed stone, and plaster. He is grateful for and values the loan, and he promises to make his monthly payments responsibly.

loans.use: to buy materials such as cement, sand, crushed stone, and plaster.

loans.name: Fatmata      S

texts.en:
Meet 21-year-old Fatmata from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. A single mother of two children aged two years and five years, she began her pure water and palm oil business in 2010 to support her family and herself. Fatmata works from 8:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. Monday to Friday. She says that her main challenges are price inflation and the high cost of living.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more items such as palm oil, pure water and soft drinks. She hopes that the extra income arising from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like palm oil, pure water and soft drinks

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es:
Salvador, tiene 47 años de edad, esta acompañado. Vive junto a su compañera de vida, con quien convive desde hace mas de 15 años, no tienen hijos.

Trabaja como empleado de vigilancia en una empresa, donde le pagan cada 15 días $91.00, aquí trabaja 24 horas y descansa 24 horas. En su día libre se dedica a trabajar en el cultivo de maíz (hasta 3500 metros cuadrados) y a veces como ayudante de albañil.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar cemento, arena,  piedra y pago de mano de obra en la elaboración de un pozo artesanal que necesita en su vivienda para el abastecimiento de agua. El préstamo le ayudara grandemente a tener un pozo para el abastecimiento del agua para el gasto de la casa y consumo.

Él con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo a logrado terminar de pagar el terreno en donde a construido su vivienda y poco a poco desea ir realizando mejoras, una de ellas es construir su casa de bloque, debido a que es de lamina en este momento.
texts.en:
Salvador is 47 years old and he is in a relationship. He lives together with his life companion, with whom he has lived for more than 15 years; they don't have children. 

He works as a security guard in a business, where they pay him $91 every 15 days. There, he works 24 hours and then has 24 hours off. In his free time, he works farming corn (up to 3,500 square meters) and sometimes as a construction assistant. 

The loan that he is requesting from Fundación Campo is for buying cement, sand, and stone, and to pay for labor to build a handmade well that he needs in his house to supply water. The loan will help him a great deal toward having a well to supply water for household use and consumption. 

With lots of effort and work, Salvador has managed to finish paying for the land where he has built his house little by little. He would like to continue making improvements; one of them is to build his house of cinderblock, as it is currently made of metal sheeting.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and stone, and to pay for labor for building a handmade well that he needs to supply water in his home.

loans.name: Adrian Arturo

texts.es:
Adrian tiene 23 años, vive con sus padres, en el cantón de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Aso. 10 de Septiembre que esta ubicado en Lechugalito   es un recinto que pertenece al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.  Son 21 socios en total, es una comunidad Agrícola y Pecuaria en su mayoría.

Adrian trabaja en la agricultura para incrementar la economía de la familia. El cultivo que más sobresale  es el maíz. Vende los productos en el mercado de Mocache.

A Adrian le gusta hacer deporte en la comunidad. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el trabajo del campo y sobre todo para fertilizantes y abonos.  Su meta es mejorar su situación económica pera beneficio de la familia. Los desafíos que enfrenta es tener una casa decente para vivir.
texts.en:
Adrian is 23 years old. He lives with his parents in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. 

He belongs to the "10 de Septiembre" communal bank, located in Lechugalito, which is a small rural settlement in Ventanas. There are 21 members in total. For the most part, it is a farming and livestock-raising community. 

Adrian works in agriculture to increase the family income. The crop that stands out most is corn. He sells his harvests in the market in Mocache. He likes to participate in sports in his community. 

Adrian is requesting the loan to buy supplies for working the land and above all, fertilizers and soil amendments. His goal is to improve his economic situation to benefit his family. The challenge he is facing is having a decent house to live in.

loans.use: to buy supplies for working the land and above all, fertilizers and soil amendments.

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Chanthy (pictured here) is a rice farmer. She lives in a village approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh city. She has three children-two sons and one daughter. One child is a garment worker, another attends school, and the youngest stays at home. 

Chanthy hopes to expand her land property, therefore she is applying for a loan to buy her neighboring land.

loans.use: To buy her neighboring land to expand her land property.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
This is Marilyn.  Her previous loan was a big help in her business.  She was able to buy more products for her variety store.  Her business income also helped her to send her children to school and to pay her everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory.  The more items displayed at the store the better.  More items to sell will result in better profits.  The profits from her business will definitely help to sustain her daily needs.  She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marilyn dreams that her business will continue to grow.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone!  This is 33-year-old Fatmata from Waterloo, which is in the Eastern area in Freetown.  She is married with 3 children between the ages of 1 and 19 years old.  Two of her children attend school.  She started a business to earn a daily survival income for her family. 

Fatmata has been running a groundnuts business since 2005, selling groundnuts within her community.  She works at the business from 4:30 and will not rest until the food is finished.  Fatmata says that the main challenge to her business is price control in the market.

Fatmata has requested a loan in order to buy food commodities, such as cooking seasoning, oil, and rice.  The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business.  In the future, she plans to have a permanent business residence.  She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy food commodities, such as seasoning, oil, and rice.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is a resident of Caloocan, Pasay, Philippines.  She is a 58-year-old widow with three children, all of whom are working.  Life, indeed, is hard.  But, by the grace of God, she was able to raise her children well and to continue working to cover her everyday needs.

Salvacion owns a variety store.  This is a small store, just connected to or just inside the house, which can be owned by anyone in the community.  This is where you can buy a sachet of shampoo, conditioner, a bar of soap, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg, for example.  Salvacion obtains her products from a wholesaler at a lower price then sells it at a higher price for profit.  She also sells charcoal and rice.  Her regular customers are her neighbors, passersby, and the people in the community.  She earns 700 PHP a day.

She is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan in order to expand her inventory (groceries, toiletries, beverage, etc.).  This loan will be a great help for her to add more products to her store.  Salvacion hopes that her business will grow and expand.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Mamie from Waterloo, which is in the Eastern area in Freetown.  She is single with 3 children between the ages of 9 and 15 years old.  Mamie has been running a business selling gari within the community.  She began this business 5 years ago to create income for the home.  She works at the business every day, from morning to night.  She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Mamie has requested a loan in order to purchase items such as bags of groundnut and gari.  The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay school fees and improve her standard of living.  In the future, she plans to open a shop.  She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase items such as bags of groundnut and gari.

loans.name: Kihondo Women Group

texts.en: Patrick is a member of Kihondo Women’s Group. Each member guarantees the others in accessing a loan. He is a 29-year-old married man with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is transport, alongside growing tomatoes. Good father that he is, he desires to educate his children up to university and set up sustainable income generating projects for them. Like most farmers, he is challenged by unpredictable weather changes. His dream is to become a model farmer. Patrick intends to use this loan to buy fertilizers for his garden.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his garden.

loans.name: Concepción Suyapa

texts.es:
Doña Concepción pertenece al municipio de  Niquinohomo, municipio que fue elegido para el programa de creación de alianzas para el fortalecimiento de las capacidades locales para el saneamiento de Nicaragua, es casada, con  41 años de edad,  Comerciante, su negocio consiste en comercializar  artesanía en diferentes lugares del país, ya que sale a vender sus productos. Su núcleo familiar es sus dos hijos y su esposo. 

Actualmente están aplicando para el proyecto de agua y saneamiento, a través de  un financiamiento para   el mejoramiento de su unidad sanitaria ya que no cuenta con la condiciones necesaria para utilizarla, el mejoramiento consiste en el levantado de paredes  y cerramiento de la unidad sanitaria, ya que conocen la importancia de utilizar un saneamiento mejorado, a través de la alianza  su familia  tiene acceso al  saneamiento mejorado, con este proyecto que esta beneficiando a varios municipios del país, le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y también contribuir con el medio ambiente.
 
Estos programas vienen ayudar a familias en condiciones mas pobres, las letrinas causan enfermedades y contaminan el medio ambiente, es por ello que nace la idea de crear estas soluciones dirigidas al sector más pobres.
texts.en:
Concepción belongs to the town of Niquinohomo, a town chosen for the alliance creating program to fortify local capacity for Nicaragua's sanitation. She is married and 41 years old. She is a merchant and her business is selling artisanal crafts in different parts of the country, since she goes out to sell her products. Her nuclear family is her two children and her husband. 

Right now, she is applying for the water and sanitation project through a loan to improve her bathroom, since it in no condition to be used. The improvement is putting up walls and closing in the bathroom, since they know how important it is to use the improved bathroom. Through the alliance, her family has access to the improved sanitation. With this project a lot of towns in the country are improving. This will allow her to improve their quality of life and contribute to the environment. 
 
These programs come to help families in the poorest conditions. Latrines cause illness and pollute the environment. That is where the idea to create these solutions are directed at the poorest sectors of the country.

loans.use: to buy materials to improve a bathroom, such as iron rods, sand, crushed stone, quarry stone, cement, etc.

loans.name: Piedras Blancas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PIEDRAS BLANCAS” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por once  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Yanety es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de leche, venta de queso, tejido de mantas, venta de muebles usados.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Yanety es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de muebles usados; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por consejo de su familia, ya que ellos realizan reparaciones de muebles en desuso.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de su mercadería (compra de muebles usados) que adquirirá a domicilio y posteriormente al arreglo del mueble lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella aún vive con su madre.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el trabajar en grupo y sus compañeras.
texts.en:
The Piedras Blancas communal bank started its third loan cycle with Kiva partner Pro Mujer as part of the Primary Focus of German Busch. It is formed of 11 members and is led by a board of directors, for which Yanety is the secretary. The members' businesses are succeeding and are varied, including selling milk, selling cheese, weaving blankets, and selling used furniture.

The loan they will take out will benefit small micro-businesses, of which Yanety is a member. She indicates that it has been a year since she started with Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Now she has a business selling used furniture. She says 
she learned this business with her family's guidance because they repair discarded furniture.

The loan she is now taking out is to stock up on merchandise (purchase used furniture), which she will acquire from homes and later, after fixing it up, will sell in her sales space. This type of work allows her to generate income to maintain her home because she still lives with her mother.

When she was asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes to work with the group and her friends.

loans.use: purchase used furniture.

loans.name: 25 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “25 DE DICIEMBRE” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Patricia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: restaurant, venta de ojalatas, radio taxi, costura, venta de ropa de bebe, taller de tapicería, tejido de gorro, carpintería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Patricia es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió conjuntamente su hermano,  hace varios años, y en la actualidad lo sigue trabajando porque su hermano dejo este oficio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de su mercadería (compra de papa, arroz, fideo, etc.) que adquirirá de las ferias aledañas y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The lending group "25 de Diciembre" will start their 3rd cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the focal center German Busch. There are 9 members and a board of directors, of whom Patricia acts as president. The members' businesses are varied and include: a restaurant, selling tin, a taxi cab, sewing, selling baby clothes, upholstery, sewing hats, and carpentry.

The loan will benefit these small businesses, including Patricia's. She has been through 4 cycles with Pro Mujer, starting at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. She currently has a business selling food. She started it together with her brother some years ago, and she continues it though her brother has left his role in business.

The loan will be used to increase her merchandise by purchasing potatoes, rice, noodles, etc, that she will get in village markets and later use to make food that she will sell in her stall. This work will allow her to generate resources to maintain her house, as she is married and has 2 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she enjoys the parts related to health.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, rice, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 55 años, es viuda y vive en su casa propia junto sus 2 hijos. Ana se dedica a la venta de ropas de segunda de damas, caballeros y niños. Ella vende a sus conocidos, que también le traen negocio de otras personas. Tiene más de 10 años dedicándose a este negocio y hasta el momento tiene el apoyo de su hija menor. Le gusta su negocio ya que le genera ingresos económicos r. Considera su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda que tiene estos productos y las buenas ganancias que le deja. Por otro lado tiene planes de seguir creciendo como negociante. Este será su quinto préstamo con Kiva. Está muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio.  Con el monto de 1000 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de más mercaderías como ropas de damas, caballeros y niños.
texts.en: Ana is 55 years old. She is widowed and lives in her own home with her two children. Ana sells second-hand clothes for women, men, and children. She sells to her acquaintances, who also take the business to other people. She has been in this business for more than 10 years, and, so far, has had the support of her younger daughter. She likes her business, as it generates income. She feels her business is profitable enough because of the demand for her products and the good revenues it brings her. On the other hand, she has plans to continue growing as a businesswoman. This will be her fifth loan with Kiva. She is very happy to know that she will have financial support because this way, she will feel confident in growing her business. With the loan of 1,000 nuevos soles, she will purchase more merchandise, such as clothes for women, men, and children.

loans.use: purchase more clothes for women, men, and children, to sell.

loans.name: Elba

texts.es: La señora Elba, es una persona de 25 años de edad, actualmente vive en el domicilio de su madre, de estado civil soltera, alcanzo a estudiar el bachillerato en humanidades y cuenta con un dependiente económico a cargo el cual es su pequeño hijo. La actividad económica principal que desarrolla es prestar servicios de costura; manifiesta que este servicio lo realiza durante casi toda la gestión anual para las diferentes tiendas de costura de la ciudad de Cochabamba que ofertan estas prendas, confecciona como ser cortinas, blusas de damas y entre otros arreglos en general. Asimismo la señora Elba en determinadas épocas de la gestión como en el día de la madre, julio, septiembre y en época de navidad se dedica a la venta de regalos como ser peluches, tarjetas y otros regalos en general lo cual le permite generar ingresos económicos adicionales. Y  finalmente la señora Elba tiene ganas de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su hijo y para tal efecto se ve en la necesidad de solicitar capital de inversión para construir la obra fina de su vivienda la cual construyo en la casa de su madre.
texts.en: Elba is 25 years old. Right now she lives in her mother's house. She in single and was able to graduate from high school with a focus in humanities. She has a financial dependent, who is her young son. Her main economic activity is offering sewing services. She says that she does this for nearly the whole year for different sewing stores in the city of Cochabamba that sell different clothing. She makes curtains, blouses for women and other general items.  At other times of the year, such as Mother's Day, July, September, and Christmas, Elba sells gifts such as stuffed animals, cards and other general gift items, which allows her to generate additional income. And finally, Elba wants to improve her and her son's quality of life and to do that she needs to ask for investment capital to do the finishings on her house that she built on her mother's property.

loans.use: to build a house.

loans.name: Ma. Elna

texts.en:
Ma. Elna is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of four young children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is engaged in the retail sale of cosmetics and other personal products. This is the source of her income. 

Ma. Elna is asking for a loan to buy more cosmetics products like lotion, fragrance, lipstick and other items. With this loan, she will be able to sell more to her customers, thus augmenting her sales and income. 

Ma. Elna dreams of making her business a success and a stable source of her income. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics products like lotion, fragrance, lipstick and other items.

loans.name: Yemalin-Femi 3 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement YEMALIN-FEMI 3 est composé de neuf personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Jeanne est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour une troisième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Jeanne a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Jeanne est âgée de 54 ans. Jeanne est veuve et mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Les charges du ménage sont assurées par Jeanne. C'est pour cette raison que Jeanne vend depuis sept ans, des fruits et des produits vivriers à son domicile. Jeanne s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Jeanne et les autres membres du groupement YEMALIN-FEMI 3 sollicitent un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The YEMALIN FEMI-3 group is composed of nine people who live in the same neighborhood.

Jeanne, the representative of the group, is the person raising her hand on the photo.  To raise the level of their activity and better cope with the demands of their customers, the group asks for a third time financial support from ALIDé.

Jeanne left school at the secondary level. She is 54 years old, a widow and mother of three children, all of whom attend school and are her dependents. Jeanne takes care of household expenses. This is why for the past seven years Jeanne has been selling fruits and produce from her home. She gets her supplies from one of Benin's markets.

To strengthen their business and better serve their customers, Jeanne and other members of the YEMALIN 3-FEMI group are requesting a third loan from ALIDé. Their aim is to increase the level of their activity. Previous loans have been fully repaid.

loans.use: Buy fruits and produce.

loans.name: Adriana Gabriela

texts.es:
Doña Adriana pertenece al municipio de  Niquinohomo, municipio que fue elegido para el programa de creación de alianzas para el fortalecimiento de las capacidades locales para el saneamiento de Nicaragua, es soltera, con  28 años de edad, es trabajadora del estado se desempeña como técnica Municipal brinda apoyo a la educación de Jóvenes adultos, es de ingreso bajos, vive con su mama que es a quien ella apoya económicamente.

Actualmente están aplicando para el proyecto de agua y saneamiento a través de un financiamiento para el mejoramiento de su unidad sanitaria ya que no cuenta con la condiciones necesaria para utilizarla, el mejoramiento consiste en el levantado de paredes  y cerramiento de la unidad sanitaria, ya que conocen la importancia de utilizar un saneamiento mejorado, a través de la alianza  su familia  tienen acceso al  saneamiento mejorado, con este proyecto que esta beneficiando a varios municipios del país, le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida  y  también contribuir con el medio ambiente. 

Estos programas vienen ayudar a familias en condiciones mas pobres, las letrinas causan enfermedades y contaminan el medio ambiente, es por ello que nace la idea de crear estas soluciones dirigidas al sector más pobres.
texts.en:
Adriana lives in Niquinohomo, a town that was selected for a program to create partnerships to strengthen the local capacity for sanitation in Nicaragua. She is single, 28 years old. She is an employee of the state and works as a city staff member, giving educational support to young adults. This is a low-paying job. She lives with her mother, whom she supports financially.

She is now applying for the water and sanitation project, for a loan to improve her restroom because she doesn't have the necessary conditions to use it. The improvement consists of raising the walls and closing off the sanitary unit because people are familiar with the importance of using improved sanitation. Because of the partnership, her family has access to better sanitation. Several towns in the country are benefiting from this project. It will allow her to improve her quality of life and also contribute to the surrounding area.

These programs come to help families living in the most poor conditions. Latrines cause illness and contaminate the surrounding area. This is why the idea came about to create these solutions directed to the most poor sectors.
