She is requesting a loan to increase her work capital buying hats wholesale from distributors in the city of El Alto.  She will then sell them at her stall.  This type of work allows her to generate enough income to cover her household expenses.  She is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says it is the training sessions and loans.

loans.use: To buy hats.

loans.name: Yervacio

texts.es: El Sr. Yervacio sigue con la  misma actividad de transporte y venta de material de construcción ya que se encarga de trasladar material de construcción a distintas obras de la ciudad de La Paz, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de llantas para su camión,  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para mantenimiento de su camión ya que esta presentando algunas fallas y esto por el peso que transporta puede ocasionar un accidente , este es el motivo de su crédito , el Sr. Yervacio se siente agradecido por esta oportunidad que le vuelven a dar ya que así mejora en su actividad y también  en sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Yervacio continues in the same transport business and selling construction materials.  He takes construction materials to different building sites around the city of La Paz.  He says he used the previous loan to buy tires for his truck.

On this occasion, he is requesting a loan to pay for vehicle maintenance since his truck is beginning to show signs of failure and this could be dangerous given the weight he carries.  

Yervacio is grateful for this new opportunity to improve his business and income.

loans.use: To pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Marlinda

texts.es: Marlinda, de 44 años de edad, es madre soltera de 6 hijos pero solo vive con dos de sus hijas y sus nietas. La actividad que realiza Marlinda es la agricultura, tiene un terreno de 10 hectáreas las cuales  ha destinado a la siembra de cultivos, contando con 8 hectáreas de cacao y 1 hectárea de plátano, el terreno restante esta orientado a la crianza de animales. Comenta que le gusta la vida de campo, además conoce el ritmo del trabajo y como ejecutarlo ya que desde muy joven cumplió esta función con ayuda de sus padres. Sin embargo, asegura que el cansancio físico es constante ya que es un trabajo que exige mucho esfuerzo, a pesar de ello le llena de satisfacción los ingresos económicos que percibe ya que eso le permite tener el dinero necesario para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia por lo que espera seguir trabajando de la misma forma. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, está muy emocionada al saber que hay personas que le brindan un respaldo económico para continuar desarrollando su actividad laboral, así mismo se compromete a ser una socia puntual y responsable. El monto solicitado lo invertirá en abono orgánico para sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Marlinda, who is 44 years old, is a single mother of 6 children, but she only lives with two of her children and her grandchildren. Marlinda works in agriculture. She has 10 hectares of land, which is dedicated to the growth of crops. She has 8 hectares of cacao, 1 hectare of bananas, and she uses the rest of the land to raise animals.

She says that she likes living in the country since she knows the rhythm of the work and how to execute it because she has been doing it since she was young with the help of her parents. Nonetheless, she reports that she is constantly physically exhausted because the work requires a lot of effort. In spite of this, the income that she receives makes her very satisfied because it allows her to have the money necessary to give her family a better quality of life. This is why she hopes to continue working in the same manner.

At this time, she requests a loan of 1,000 Nuevos Soles. She is very excited to find out that there are people who will give her the economic support to continue to develop her work. She promises to be a punctual and responsible associate. The loan that she has requested will be invested in organic manure for her fields.

loans.use: to buy organic manure for her fields.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: El señor Roberto, es una persona trabajadora se dedica a la agricultura (tiene plantaciones de naranja), a la crianza de pescados y en sus días libres se dedica al servicio de transporte; trabaja todos los días para mantener a sus cuatro hijos y a su querida concubina, ni aun así le alcanza dinero para los estudios de sus hijos, para su alimentación, mantenimiento de su chaco y mantenimiento de su vehiculo, por tal motivo el señor solicita que se le haga un financiamiento para que pueda ampliar sus cítricos y así poder mejorar sus ingresos económicos para que a su familia no le falte alimentación ni ropa y que para que siempre estén en buena salud y que sus  hijos puedan estudiar sin que les falte nada.
texts.en:
Roberto is a hardworking person who earns a living from farming (he grows oranges) and breeding fish and on his free days he provides a transportation service. He works every day to support his four children and his beloved partner but even so he doesn't have enough money for his children's education and food and for the upkeep of his farm and maintenance of his vehicle. 

For this reason Roberto is asking for a loan so he can increase the number of his citrus trees and so improve his income so that his family has enough food and clothing, so they always have good health and so that his children can study and not have to go without anything.

loans.use: to increase the number of his citrus trees.

loans.name: Jorge Iván

texts.es: Jorge a sus 48 años de edad se dedica a la ebanistería y tapicería de muebles, actividad con la cual obtiene ingresos para aportar económicamente en su hogar, donde vive con su madre, ya que no es casado y no ha tenido hijos. Es un hombre emprendedor y le gusta estar en constante actividad para sentirse útil, por lo que se motiva para solicitar su primer crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en el pago de un curso de capacitación en elaboración de Tortas, Batidos y Galletas, ya que ve en esto una oportunidad de negocio rentable y sostenible en el tiempo. Jorge sueña con hacer crecer su negocio de ebanistería y a mediano plazo poder aumentar sus ingresos con el montaje de un negocio de  panificación y repostería, para así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jorge, 48, is a carpenter and furniture upholsterer.  He contributes his income to the home he shares with his mother since he is single and has no children.  He is an entrepreneur who always wants to be active and feel useful; and therefore he is requesting his first loan to pay for a course in making cakes, milk-shakes and cookies.  He sees this business opportunity as being profitable and sustainable over time.

Jorge's goal is to expand his carpentry business and increase his income, in the medium term, by setting up a bakery business.  His aim is to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: To pay for a cake, milk-shake and cookie making training course.

loans.name: Marisela

texts.es: Marisela tiene 31 años, está divorciada y vive en la casa de sus padres junto sus 3 hijos. Marisela se dedica al transporte para esto cuenta con un mototaxi. Tiene 03 años dedicándose a éste negocio y cuenta con el apoyo de su padre en la administración de sus recursos. Le gusta su negocio pues le genera un ingreso económico y se siente una persona productiva con los gastos del hogar. Tiene planes de incursionar en otro negocio como abrir una tienda de venta de repuestos de motos. Este será su primer préstamo con Kiva. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Con el monto de 1000 nuevos soles los invertirá en compra de repuestos para el mantenimiento de sus unidades como llantas, aceites y otros.
texts.en:
Marisela, 31, is divorced and lives with her parents and her three children.  She is in the transport business and owns a motor-taxi.  For three years she has been working in this trade with the support of her father who handles the administrative part of her resources.  She enjoys what she does because it generates an income and makes her feel like a productive person when it comes to paying for household expenses.

Marisela has plans to open another business, such as a motorcycle spare parts store. This is her first Kiva loan and she is counting on you to help so she can carry out her plans.  The  loan in the amount of 1,000 PEN will be used to buy spare parts such as tires, oil and other maintenance supplies.

loans.use: To buy tires, oil and other supplies for transport vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Marina Luz

texts.es: La Sra. Marina sigue con la actividad de la venta de cosméticos y joyas, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de colonia y perfumes al por mayor que se encuentra en promoción, cuenta que le fue bien  creció en su actividad e incremento su clientela, y por ende sus ingresos económicos, en esta ocasión solicito el crédito para la compra de cosméticos y joyaspor mayor para seguir incrementando su capital de trabajo, se siente feliz y agradecida por esta nueva oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Marina continues with her business selling cosmetics and jewelry.  She says that everything went well with her previous loan, and that she used it to buy cologne and perfume wholesale during a promotional sale.  She has grown her business, her customer base, and therefore her income.  

On this occasion, she is requesting a loan in order to purchase cosmetics and jewelry wholesale so that she can continue growing her working capital.  She feels happy and thankful for this new opportunity that has been offered to her.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and jewelry wholesale.

loans.name: Khitam

texts.en:
Khitam was born in 1958. She is a widow who lives in Amman, Jordan. 

Khitam has a mini market that she started two years ago. She started her project by buying foods and cleaners. Then she expanded her project by increasing her merchandise and sales. 

Now she is requesting a loan to buy new foods, cleaners and more products to increase her sales and income.

loans.use: To buy new foods, cleaners and more products.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofía tiene 62 años, está casada y vive en su casa propia junto su esposo, y tiene hijos ya independientes.
Sofía  se dedica a la venta de comidas regionales. Realiza la preparación en su casa y los entrega en la empresa a su hora de refrigerio. Tiene más de 10 años dedicándose a éste negocio, y hasta el momento su hija  mayor  la apoya, con la entrega de los alimentos preparados y consiguiéndole nuevos clientes.
Le gusta su negocio pues le genera un ingreso económico, y le permite tener un ocupación y sentirse un apersonas productiva. Por tanto tiene planes de continuar en el negocio y en un futuro poder abrir un restaurante en su casa. Esto será su primer préstamo con Kiva. Por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. 
Con el monto de 500 nuevos soles, los invertirá en  la compra de los ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de sus alimentos como arroz, aceites y otros.
texts.en:
Sofía is 62 years old and married. She lives in her own home with her husband, and her children are now adult.
Sofía makes a living selling regional foods. She prepares them in her house and delivers them to the company when it is time to refrigerate them. She has been in this business for more than ten years, with the help of her eldest daughter, who delivers the prepared foods and pursues new customers.
She likes this business because it gives her economic resources and allows her to keep busy and feel productive. She therefore plans to keep the business going and in the future open a restaurant in her home. This is her first loan with Kiva. She hopes for a small loan to help her meet her goals.
She will use this loan of 500 soles to buy the ingredients she needs to make her foods, such as rice, oils, and so on.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make foods, such as rice, sugar, and oils.

loans.name: Huda

texts.en:
Huda is a conservative woman so her husband is photographed in the picture.

Huda is a 43-year-old married woman. She is a mother to four sons and three daughters; they are university students. They are living in Tulkarem in a very humble house. For the past ten years, Huda’s husband has been a dentist. He has a dentist clinic which has been a profitable project, but also needs more support to cover the family's needs. Huda’s husband also has another source of income. 

Huda is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her husband to improve the dentist clinic by buying new equipment and chair to be better and more profitable. This will affect Huda’s husband's income in a positive way.

loans.use: to buy new equipment and chair for the dental clinic

loans.name: Les Christophiens 1 & 2 Group

texts.fr:
Wisdel est le coordonateur de son groupe Christophiens. Il est  mariée et elle a deux enfants. Il habite dans la region nord est d`Haïti ou de électricité est rare et de Léau portable est très limité. Il dirige son commerce de vente de sandales pendants les 10 derniers années.

Avant de ce commercer ce commerce Il était  une étudiant. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à grandir son commerce. Des autres membres de Chrisophiens ont besoin d’un  emprunt pour le commerce telque ventes produits cosmétiques boissons gazeuses etc.  Il  dit que son défit  principal est de devenir une plus grande commerçante.

Il  dit son but principal c’est d’avoir un plus grande commerce qui lui facilitera  à  construire une plus grande maison avec prêt de Esperanza Int.
texts.en:
Wisdel is the coordinator of his group Christophiens. He is married and has two children. He lives in northern Haiti, where electricity is rare and potable water is very limited. He has been running his business selling sandals for the last ten years. 

Before starting this business, he used to be a student. He hopes that this loan will help him to expand his business. Other members of the group Chrisophiens have need of a loan for businesses such as selling cosmetic products, soft drinks, etc. He says that his main challenge is to become a bigger merchant. 

He says his main goal is to have a bigger business facilitating the construction of a bigger house with loans from Esperanza Int.

loans.use: to purchase sandals

loans.name: Zahreya

texts.en:
Zahreya was born in 1965. She is divorced and lives with her two sons in Zarqa, Jordan. Her sons work in selling fruits and vegetables. 

Zahreya has been working in trading clothes and blankets for four years. She started her project at home by buying small merchandise. Then she started expanding her project after having a good number of customers, which was profitable to her. 

Now she is requesting a loan to expand her project more and to buy more clothes and blankets to trade and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and blankets to sell.

loans.name: Ghazal

texts.en:
Ghazal is 20 years old. She lives in Irbid, Jordan, with her family, which consists of seven members. 

Ghazal is studying Diploma of Accounting, first year. She is planning to work in her study field after her graduation. 

Ghazal doesn’t have enough money to pay for her study fees, so she is requesting a loan to be able to pay for it.

loans.use: To cover her study fees.

loans.name: Benito

texts.es: Don benito es una persona de escasos recursos económicos debido a que el lugar y la propiedad donde vive se encuentra a orillas del rio por tanto los terrenos son pequeños y de alto riesgo a las fuertes turbulencias de agua que se presenta y los desbordes que ocasiona, en pasada gestión agrícola don benito ha sufrido el desborde del mencionado río dejándole con un 50% de sus tierras agrícolas totalmente erosionadas llenos de piedra y desnivelación de la capa arable, por las razones descritas su producción ha bajado afectando en los rendimientos por tanto los ingresos económicos han sido también afectados por estas razones descritas don benito ha recurrido al préstamo kiva siendo esta la primera vez que solicita, con este crédito comprará semillas de buena calidad  para realizar sus actividades económicas para estabilizarse.
texts.en:
Benito is a person with very limited resources owing to the fact that the property and land where he lives is situated on the banks of a river. This means his plots of land are small and at high risk from the strong turbulence of the water and the occasions when the river bursts its banks. In previous growing seasons Benito has suffered from overflows from the river leaving 50% of his agricultural land completely eroded and full of stones and leaving the arable layer uneven. For the reasons described his production has decreased, affecting the yields and so Benito's income has also been affected.

For this reason Benito has turned to Kiva to ask for a loan for the first time. He will use the loan to buy good quality seeds to work with so he can get back to normal.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Flor Blanca Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR BLANCA” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lidia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas a mano, tienda de barrio, hilado de vicuñas, venta de queso.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lidia es integrante, ella indica que hace un año y medio que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido y venta de mantas; da a conocer que la técnica de tejido la aprendió de su Tía, posteriormente decide emprender su propio negocio, con el cual genera recursos económicos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de su mercadería (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las vendedoras por mayor y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido de la clienta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y los ahorros.
texts.en:
The "Flor Blanca" communal bank is beginning its third loan with Pro Mujer as part of the Alto Lima Regional Office. It is made up of 8 members and is directed by a governing board, of which Lidia is the president.

The businesses run by the members of the communal bank are varied and include weaving blankets by hand, operating neighborhood stores, spinning llama yarn, and selling cheese. The loan that they receive will benefit the small micro-businesses of which Lidia is a member.

She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer one and a half years ago, after she was invited by a promoter of the institution who visited her house. Currently, she weaves and sells blankets. She learned the weaving technique from her aunt and later decided to begin her own business, which generates economic resources.

The loan that she requests will be used to increase her merchandise (buying wool) that she will buy from vendors in bulk. After she creates the blankets, she will sell them as her customers order them. This manner of working permits her to generate resources to support her family. She is in a common-law marriage and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the loan and the savings.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es: La señora Janeth, es una persona de 30 años de edad, de estado civil casada con el señor Omar, alcanzo a estudiar una carrera técnica en peinados, la cual actualmente por razones personales no ejerce, cuenta con dos dependientes económicos a cargo los cuales son sus pequeños hijos y actualmente vive en casa en anticrético en la ciudad de Cochabamba. La señora Janeth y en especial su esposo trabaja diariamente prestando servicios de transporte urbano  en una línea con su propio vehículo desde hace 2 años y medio atrás esta actividad de transporte es su fuente principal para generar ingresos para el sustento de su familia. Finalmente la señora Janeth y su esposo manifiestan ser personas trabajadores y responsables que quieren mejorar sus condiciones de vida y para lo cual se ven en la necesidad de solicitar capital de inversión para realizar la construcción de una vivienda en el lote de terreno que es de su propiedad y de esta manera a futuro junto a su familia poder tener la satisfacción de habitar en su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
Janeth is 30 years old, married to Omar, and she managed to complete technical training in hair styling, though for personal reasons, she doesn't practice the profession. Janeth has 2 economic dependents in her charge, her little children, and presently, she lives in a contracted rental house in the city of Cochabamba.

Janeth and, especially, her husband, have worked daily for 2 ½ years now offering urban transportation services for a transport line with their own vehicle. This service is their principal source of generating income to sustain their family.

And, finally, Janeth and her husband have proven that they are responsible and hard-working people who wish to improve their conditions of life. For that reason they find it necessary to request capital to invest in construction of a home on a lot they own. In this manner, in the future, their family can have the satisfaction of living in their own home.

loans.use: to begin construction of herown house.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is single and has 2 children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Evelyn is a successful businesswoman. She sells cookware in Akatakyiwa (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about 3 years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Evelyn uses her income to provide for the entire family. Evelyn will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of cookware, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Evelyn plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to further diversify the type of products that she sells

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: Miriam is a 43-year-old married woman from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She runs a small sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Miriam is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies and biscuits, noodles, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to improve her store and attract more buyers. Miriam dreams of expanding her retail store and make it a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies and biscuits, noodles, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Eustaquia

texts.es: La señora Eustaquia es una persona que tiene 74 años, viuda, con tres hijos independientes que no viven en Cochabamba, tiene una pequeña granja con nueve vacas lecheras, le ayuda en la granja su nieta que vive con ella desde pequeñita, es la única persona que la acompaña desde la muerte de su esposo hacen 15 años.  Es una señora muy activa y su vida es el trabajo con su ganado lechero, actualmente varias están preñadas y necesita capital de inversión para comprar una vaquita y aumentar su producción de leche y no dejar de entregar el cupo que tiene en la planta industrializadora donde perdería la acción si baja demasiado la producción y entrega del producto.
texts.en:
Eustaquia  is a 74 year old widow with three independent children who do not live in Cochabamba. She has a small farm with nine milk cows. Her granddaughter who has lived with her since she was little helps her on the farm. She is the only support Eustaquia has had since her husband died 15 years ago.

Eustaquia is a very active lady and working with her milk herd is her life. Currently some of the cows are pregnant and she needs capital to invest in a small cow. This is to increase the milk production so that she can keep up the milk quota she supplies to the industrial plant, since she will lose her share if her production and delivery of milk decreases too much.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Osama

texts.en:
Osama is 22 years old. He lives in Zarqa, Jordan, with his family, which consists of two members. 

Osama is studying Bachelor of Rehabilitation of Sports, fourth year. One of the obstacles Osama faces is paying for his study fees with a partial payment installment. He is planning to work in his study field in the future. 

Osama needs a computer during his study, which he doesn’t have enough money to buy. He is currently seeking a loan to be able to buy it.

loans.use: To buy a computer for his study.

loans.name: Nayfa

texts.en:
Nayfa was born in 1973. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a farmer. 

Nayfa has been trading clothes for two years. She started her project at home by doing some tailoring. She found this project profitable, so she is seeking a loan to be able to buy a larger amount of clothes in order to raise her income.

loans.use: To buy a larger amount of clothes to sell in order to raise her income.

loans.name: Intisar

texts.en:
Intisar is a conservative woman, so she let her son take her place in the picture. She was born in 1974. She lives in Amman, Jordan, with her seven children. Her husband has a used furniture showroom. 

Intisar is seeking a loan to help her husband expand his showroom and to buy a larger amount of used furniture to raise their income in order to cover their children's needs.

loans.use: To buy a larger amount of used furniture and sell it.

loans.name: Israa

texts.en:
Israa is a conservative woman, so she let her brother take her place in the picture. She is 28 years old. She is married and has two children. Her husband works as a driver, which is a weak source of income. Israa has been working in trading makeup and cosmetics after she was trained in a salon and got a participating certificate. She also attended eight bazaars. 

Israa is planning to expand her project by buying more improved tools and products in the future. Now, she is seeking a youth loan to buy a larger amount of makeup and cosmetics to increase her income.

loans.use: To buy a larger amount of makeup and cosmetics to increase her income.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 22 years old. She is single and lives in Irbid, Jordan, with her family, which consists of five members. 

Lina is studying Bachelor of Finance, second year. She is planning to take courses in her field and to work in the banking sector in the future. 

Now she is requesting a loan that covers her study fees and the courses that she is planning to take.

loans.use: To cover her study fees.

loans.name: Hayat

texts.en:
Hayat was born in 1979. She lives in Amman-Jordan with her four sons. Hayat has been working in trading clothes and blankets since two years ago. She started her project at home by selling a small amount of clothes. Then she faced a great success with her work as it was profitable. 

Hayat was selling clothes with a partial payment settlement, which wasn’t letting her earn enough money to buy a large amount of merchandise. Now, she is planning to concentrate on summer clothes like T-shirts and shorts and is seeking a loan to be able to buy a larger amount of clothes.

loans.use: To buy summer clothes and trade them.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Ama did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Ama prepares and sells "kenkey" (a traditional Ghanaian staple dish that is made from corn dough and is wrapped in banana leaves) in Akatakyima (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about four years. As a divorcee with seven children, Ama uses all her income to provide for her family. 

Ama will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of maize, which will aid her in improving her overall "kenkey" sales. Ama wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of maize, which will aid her in improving her overall "kenkey" sales.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 20-year-old single man. He is living in a very humble house in Gaza. His father is a worker with a small salary that is not enough to cover all the expenses. Mohammad is requesting a $400 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. This will help Mohammad to do his homework and reports and help him to do his studies easier. This will ensure a better future for Mohammad and improve the family's living conditions. Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Esi did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Esi prepares and sells ‘Kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough, wrapped in banana leaves) in her village of Akatakyiwa (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about five years. Esi is married to a mason and, together, they have three children. 

Esi uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. She will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of maize, which will aid her in improving her overall ‘Kenkey’ sales. Esi wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of maize, which will aid her in improving her overall ‘Kenkey’ sales.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is a conservative women, so her husband took her place in the picture. Sanaa was born in 1974. She is married and has four children. Her husband has retired from military. 

Sanaa has been working in trading clothes and sewing fabric at her house for 10 years. She is planning to expand her project by selling desserts and foods in the future. Sanaa is currently requesting a loan to buy new clothes for Eid to do good sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: La Sra. Marlene tiene 43 años tiene dos hijos,  ella se dedica  a la venta y  crianza de cerdos en la localidad de Santa Rita este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Marlene va a usar este préstamo para la compra de alimento balanceado para sus cerdos, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital La Sra. Marlene enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su calidad de vida y  va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar la calidad en la alimentación de sus cerdos,  su deseo es poder tener una granja donde pueda criar cantidad de cerdos para que de esta manera pueda mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Marlene is 43 years old and has two children. She makes a living by selling and raising pigs in Santa Rita. This is her first loan with this institution.

Marlene will use this loan to buy balanced food for her pigs. The reason that she is requesting this loan is because she lacks capital.

Marlene faces challenges in her business, like improving her quality of life. She will use the benefits of the loan to improve the quality of her pigs' food.

Her goal is to be able to have a farm where she can raise a large quantity of pigs and, in this way, be able to improve her economic stability.

loans.use: to buy food for her pigs.

loans.name: Mary

texts.es: Mary, de 45 años de edad , es madre soltera de un niño de 4 años de edad con quien vive en su casa propia. Mary se dedica a la confección de ropa, por está razón tiene un taller en su hogar en donde realiza está actividad desde hace 16 años. Durante el tiempo que está dedicada a esta actividad siempre ha buscado la mejor forma para realizar su trabajo ya que muchas veces la presión de sus clientes la ha llevado a sentir que no iba a poder cumplir eficientemente con su labor, sin embargo supo hacerle frente a las adversidades y actualmente tiene planes de expansión para su negocio, ahora se preparará para empezar a confeccionar sus propios diseños y venderlos ya que tiene pedidos de sus clientes. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500 soles y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará telas, blondas, elásticos, agujas e hilos que necesita para su nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Mary, age 45, is a single mother of a four-year-old child and lives in her own home. She manufactures clothing. For this reason, she has a workshop in her home where she has operated her business for 16 years. Throughout the time she has been in business, Mary has always looked for the best way to perform her work because there have been many times when the expectations from her customers have made her feel that she should be completing her work more efficiently. Nonetheless, she has been able to deal with adversities and now has plans to expand her business. She will begin making her own designs and sell them to her customers by accepting orders.

Mary is taking this opportunity to request 1,500 PEN. She is grateful for the financial support she has received so that she can continue forward. In addition, she promises to submit her payments in a timely manner. The amount she requested will be used to buy fabrics, lace, elastic, needles, and thread for this new venture.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, lace, elastic, needles, and thread.

loans.name: Kpanda 1 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Kpanda 1 fait partie de la coopérative COOBADI et est située à Divo, une petite ville à l’est de la Côte d’Ivoire à environ 2 heures de route d’Abidjan. Le groupe est composé de 3 personnes. 
Madou a 45 ans et il est un membre du groupe Kpanda 1. Il s‘occupe de 2 personnes dans son foyer. Cela fait 5 ans qu’il fait partie de la coopérative COOBADI et il a 32 hectares de cacao. 

Grace au crédit, il va pouvoir acheter de l’engrais pour sa plantation. Ces produits vont lui permettre d’augmenter sa production et ainsi d’accroître ses revenus. 

Avec l’argent supplémentaire, il veut étendre son exploitation de cacao et diversifier ses revenus en se lançant dans l’hévéa et le palmier à huile.
texts.en:
The group "Kpanda 1" is part of the cooperative COOBADI and is located in Divo, a town in eastern Cote d'Ivoire about two hour's drive from Abidjan. The group is composed of three persons. 

Madou is 45 years old, and he is a member of the group Kpanda 1 He takes care of two persons at home. He has been a part of the cooperative COOBADI for five years, and he has 32 hectares of cocoa. 

Thanks to loans, he is going to be able to purchase some fertilizers for his plantation. These products will enable him to augment his production and thus to increase his revenues. 

With the additional money, he wants to expand his cocoa plantation and diversify his revenues by getting started in rubber trees and oil palms.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Mersy

texts.es:
Mersy tiene 35 años, está divorciada y vive en su casa propia junto su único hijo.
Mersy se dedica a la venta de ropas de segunda de damas, caballeros y niños. Tiene más de 02 años dedicándose a este negocio y hasta el momento tiene el apoyo de su mamá quien le ayuda consiguiéndole más clientes.
 Le gusta su negocio ya que le genera ingresos económicos además de atener atender a las personas de manera amable, logrando ganarse una clientela regular. Considera su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda que tiene estos productos y las buenas ganancias que le deja. 
Esto será su primer préstamo con Kiva. Está muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. 
Con el monto de 800 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de más mercaderías como ropas de damas, caballeros y niños para vender.
texts.en:
Mersy is 35 years old, is divorced and lives in her own house with her only son. Mersy makes a living selling second hand clothing for men, women and children. She has been in business for 2 years and up until now she has had help from her mum who helps her to find more customers. She likes her business since it gives her an income and by serving people in a friendly way she is building up a regular clientele. She thinks her business is worthwhile because of the demand for these products and the good profits she gets. 

This will be her first loan with Kiva. She is very happy to know that she will have financial support as this will make her feel more sure of being able to grow the business. She will use the sum of 800 nuevos soles to buy clothing for men, women and children which she can sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothing for men, women and children.

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is 27 years old. She is married and has eight children. Her husband is in the military. 

Manal has been working in trading blankets and housewares for two years. She started her project at home with trading blankets only. Then she expanded her project with trading housewares. 

As she is out of housewares, she is requesting a youth loan to buy new merchandise and to buy more blankets for the aim of increasing her profit.

loans.use: To buy more housewares and blankets and trade them.

loans.name: Nubia Estella

texts.es: Nubia Estella es una mujer de 39 años de edad, casada y madre de cuatro hijos de 17, 13, dos de 3 años. Desde joven ha trabajado en la actividad comercial, inició laborando con un familiar en una distribuidora, luego montó una salsamentaria, pero por cuestiones de salud en su último embarazo, tuvo que cerrarlo; en el año 2011 comenzó a vender mercancía, ropa, calzado, accesorios y productos por catálogo, con esta actividad tiene la oportunidad de estar al frente de su hogar y cuidar a sus hijos. Es una mujer emprendedora y con ganas de salir adelante, por eso solicita el quinto ciclo de crédito con la Corporación, el cual desea invertir en la compra de mercancía y productos al por mayor (ropa, accesorios, perfumería, cosméticos, entre otros) con el fin de aprovechar los descuentos que le ofrecen y así poder tener más variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y mejorar las ventas. Nubia sueña con hacer crecer su negocio, convertirlo en un almacén, que le genere mayores ingresos para brindar una mejor educación a sus hijos y mejorar la calidad de vida de toda la familia.
texts.en:
Nubia Estrella is a 39-year-old woman who is married and the mother of four children (ages 17, 13, and 3-year-old twins). From a young age, Nubia has worked in the retail business. She started out working with a relative at a distribution center. Later on, she opened a delicatessen, but she had to close that business because of health problems related to her last pregnancy.

In 2011, Nubia began selling merchandise such as clothes, shoes, accessories, and other products through catalogs. This business has given her the opportunity to keep her household on track and to take care of her children. She is an enterprising woman who has the drive to succeed. For this reason, Nubia is requesting her fifth loan from Interactuar. She wants to invest in the purchase of merchandise and products in bulk (clothing, accessories, perfumes, cosmetics, and other items) so that she can take advantage of the discounts being offered. This will give her a wider variety of products to offer to her customers, thereby improving her sales.

Nubia dreams of growing her business and converting it into a retail shop. This would generate more income so that she can provide a better education for her children and an improved quality of life for her entire family.

loans.use: to buy clothing, accessories, perfumes, cosmetics, and other items in bulk.

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en:
Suzette is a dried fish vendor from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is a married woman and has three children. 

Suzette is asking for a loan to buy more fish, to dry and sell. With this loan, she will be able to improve her stocks, thus allowing her to sell more to the people in her place. 

Suzette hopes of expanding her business, so that she will be able to support the schooling of her children and help her husband provide for their needs.

loans.use: to buy more fish, to dry and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her purchase more varieties of cloth for resale.

loans.name: Hermankono Diès 4 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Hermankono Diès 4 fait partie de la coopérative COOBADI et est située à Divo, une petite ville à l’est de la Côte d’Ivoire à environ 2 heures de route d’Abidjan. Le groupe est composé de 2 personnes. 
Dogatene a 31 ans et il est un membre du groupe Hermankono Diès 4. Il s'occupe de 15 personnes dans son foyer. Cela fait 3 ans qu’il fait partie de la coopérative COOBADI et il a 4 hectares de cacao certifié Rainforest Alliance, ce qui veut dire qu’il respecte les principes et les normes de l’agriculture durable. 

Grace au crédit, il va pouvoir acheter de l’engrais pour sa plantation. Ces produits vont lui permettre d’augmenter sa production et ainsi d’accroître ses revenus. 

Avec l’argent supplémentaire, il veut construire une maison.
texts.en:
The group "Hermankono Diès 4" is part of the cooperative COOBADI and is located in Divo, a town in eastern Cote d'Ivoire and about two hour's drive from Abidjan. The group is composed of two persons. 

Dogatene is 31 years old, and he is a member of the group Hermankono Diès 4. He takes care of fifteen persons at home. He has been a part of the cooperative COOBADI for three years, and he has 4 hectares of cocoa with Rainforest Alliance certification, which means he respects the principles and standards of sustainable agriculture. 

Thanks to loans, he is going to be able to purchase some fertilizers for his plantation. These products will enable him to augment his production and thus to increase his revenues. 

With the additional money, he wants to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Hermankono Diès 2 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Hermankono Diès 2 fait partie de la coopérative COOBADI et est située à Divo, une petite ville à l’est de la Côte d’Ivoire à environ 2 heures de route d’Abidjan. Le groupe est composé de 3 personnes. 
Ouattara a 49 ans et il est un membre du groupe Hermankono Diès 2. Il s‘occupe de 6 personnes dans son foyer. Cela fait 3 ans qu’il fait partie de la coopérative COOBADI et il a 5,5 hectares de cacao certifié UTZ, ce qui veut dire qu’il respecte les principes et les normes de l’agriculture durable. 

Grace au crédit, il va pouvoir acheter de l’engrais pour sa plantation. Ces produits vont lui permettre d’augmenter sa production et ainsi d’accroître ses revenus. 

Avec l’argent supplémentaire, il veut scolariser ses enfants et achever la construction de sa maison.
texts.en:
The group "Hermankono Diès 2" is part of the cooperative COOBADI and is located in Divo, a town in eastern Cote d'Ivoire about two hour's drive from Abidjan. The group is composed of three persons. 

Ouattara is 49 years old, and he is a member of the group Hermankono Diès 2. He takes care of six persons at home. He has been a part of the cooperative COOBADI for three years, and he has 5.5 hectares of cocoa with UTZ certification, which means he respects the principles and standards of sustainable agriculture. 

Thanks to loans, he is going to be able to purchase some fertilizers for his plantation. These products will enable him to augment his production and thus to increase his revenues. 

With the additional money, he wants to provide education for his children and finish building his house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 44-year-old married father of two children. He is a taxi driver and for 22 years he has transported people every day between Lebanon and Syria. His wife is employed in a clothing shop. Both his children are enrolled in a public school because he does not have the sufficient funds to provide them with a better education. 

He decided to contact Al Majmoua and acquire a loan in order to purchase furniture for his new livingroom. In fact, this would at least enhance the environment that he and his family live in. 

In the future, Hussein wishes to purchase a second car in order to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for his new livingroom.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a widow. After successfully graduating from middle school, she is now an established businesswoman. She sells tomatoes, onions, and magie cubes in Akpafu Mempeasem, Hohoe. She has been actively involved in this business for about 25 years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Eunice uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Eunice will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of tomatoes, onions, and magie cubes, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Eunice plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customers' preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of tomatoes, onions, and magie cubes, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Elizabeth did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Elizabeth sells provisions in Soba (near Hohoe). She has been doing so for about five years. As a single mother with two children, Elizabeth uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. 

Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of groceries for resale, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Elizabeth wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of groceries for resale.

loans.name: Habiba Group

texts.en:
Habiba is a group composed of three Lebanese women living in a small town in Mount Lebanon. They decided to join hands and form the group in order to support each other financially. 

Layal is the leader and featured member of this group. She is a 26-year-old married mother of one child, standing at the far left of the picture holding her baby girl. She works as an accountant, gives private lessons, and is enrolled in university. Her husband works in the decoration sector in Libya. She decided to join the group and acquire a group loan in order to settle her university tuition fees. This will enable her to graduate and enhance the living conditions of her family by acquiring a proper job.

As for the other group members, Randa is standing in the center of the picture, while Raghida is standing on the far right of the picture.

loans.use: to settle her university tuition fees.

loans.name: Kelly

texts.es:
Kelly tiene 26 años, está casada y vive en su propia casa junta su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Kelly  se dedica al cultivo de de yucas y plátanos  para la venta en los mercados,  además de tener sombríos de palma aceitera contando para eso con un terreno de 20 hectáreas  que lo adquirió hace 06  años, contando con la ayuda de su esposo  en las cosechas  compartiendo las ganancias.Le gusta su negocio pues lo conoce muy bien ya que lleva años dedicándose a ese oficio, además de las ganancias que le deja con la cual ha sabido mantener a su familiar y procurar que no les falte lo necesario. Tiene deseos de ampliar su negocio y dejar a sus hijos con algo seguro para su futuro.Este será su primer préstamo con Kiva, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. 

Con el monto de 800 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de abono orgánico para la producción de palma.
texts.en: Kelly is 26 years old. She is married and lives in her own home with her husband and their two children. She grows cassava and plantains to sell in the market, and she also grows palms for palm oil on 20 hectares of land that she purchased six years ago. Her husband helps her with the harvests and shares the profits. She likes this business because she's been doing it for many years and knows it well. In addition, the income it provides has helped her support her family and make sure they lack nothing. She would like to expand her business and leave her children something secure for their future. This will be her first loan with Kiva, and she hopes for their collaboration to pursue her goals. She will use the 800 soles to buy organic fertilizer for growing palm trees.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for growing palm trees.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
After graduating junior-high school, Rose decided to set up her own ‘Banku’ selling business (Banku is a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth whitish consistent paste). She prepares her ‘Banku’ on her own and proceeds to sell it in Akpafu Mempeasem (near Hohoe). 

With over two years-worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more maize and cassava, thus enabling her to prepare and sell more of her tasty ‘Banku’. She aims at using the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a farmer) with the upkeep of their house whilst ensuring that their four children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to help her purchase more maize and cassava, thus enabling her to prepare and sell more of her tasty ‘Banku’.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of African cloth and ladies' underwear for resale.

loans.name: Binkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Binkadi 1 fait partie de la coopérative COOBAD et est située à Agboville, une petite ville à l’est de la Côte d’Ivoire à environ 2 heures de route d’Abidjan. Le groupe est composé de 6 personnes. 
Rene a 35 ans et il est un membre du groupe Binkadi 1. Il s‘occupe de 3 personnes dans son foyer. Cela fait 4 ans qu’il fait partie de la coopérative COOBAD et il a 7 hectares de cacao certifié Rainforest Alliance et UTZ, ce qui veut dire qu’il respecte les principes et les normes de l’agriculture durable. 

Grace au crédit, il va pouvoir acheter de l’engrais pour sa plantation. Ces produits vont lui permettre d’augmenter sa production et ainsi d’accroître ses revenus. 

Avec l’argent supplémentaire, il veut l'élevage de porcs.
texts.en:
The group "Binkadi 1" is part of the cooperative COOBAD and is located in Agboville, a town in eastern Cote d'Ivoire and about two hour's drive from Abidjan. The group is composed of six persons. 

Rene is 35 years old, and he is a member of the group Binkadi 1. He takes care of three persons at home. He has been a part of the cooperative COOBAD for four years, and he has 7 hectares of cocoa with Rainforest Alliance and UTZ certification, which means he respects the principles and standards of sustainable agriculture. 

Thanks to loans, he is going to be able to purchase some fertilizers for his plantation. These products will enable him to augment his production and thus to increase his revenues. 

With the additional money, he wants to raise pigs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for his sustainable cocoa plantation

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.es: El  señor Cristóbal es una persona que se dedica a la agricultura desde muy joven ya que su padre le inculco a esta actividad y  al pasar los años fue ganando experiencia por lo tanto el resto de su vida la dedico a esta actividad que es el sustento de su familia; él les colabora hasta que todos sus hijos  ya sean independientes económicamente, después de la muerte de su esposa cuenta con la ayuda para el preparado del terreno y producción lo hace con la ayuda de su nieto mayor que todavía está estudiando, es una persona trabajadora que se dedica a la producción de papa, cebolla, zanahoria y ajo en sus terrenos que encuentran en la población de Parotani que se caracteriza por ser un terreno rico en minerales y humedad que favorecen al crecimiento de este tipo de productos que son de alta demanda para el consumo en la ciudad de Cochabamba.El señor Cristobla solicita un credito para la compra de semillas, ya que de esta manera podra tener ingresos que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cristobal has worked in agriculture since he was young, when his father initiated him into the business, and he has been gaining experience through the years. He has dedicated the rest of his life to this business, which supports his family.

His children worked with him and now they are all economically independent. After the death of his wife, he relies on help to prepare the land and produce the crops. His oldest grandson, who is still in school, helps him with this.

He is a hard-working man who grows potatoes, onions, carrots, and garlic. His fields are located in Parotani and are characterized by soil rich in minerals and moisture that favor the growth of these types of products, which are in high demand in the city of Cochabamba.

Cristobal requests the loan to buy seeds, so that he can earn income that will allow him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of maize and sugar.

loans.name: Gaspar

texts.es:
Gaspar es de la ciudad de Ybycui, el esta estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, por medio de la cual podrá ayudar a su familia y ser un gran profesional. 
Su meta es poder ser un profesional que pueda ayudar a las personas. También desea poder tener su propio negocio y aplicar los conocimientos que ha adquirido con sus estudios.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma poder aligerar un poco su carga de pagos. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
Gaspar comes from the town of Ybycuí. He is attending university where he is studying Business Administration in order to become a good professional thus succeeding in helping his family.
His goal is to become a professional who succeeds in helping people; at the same time he wants to run his own activity in order to put what he has learned through his studies into practice.
The loan he is requesting will be used to pay for university fees, in order to reduce a little the amount of his school debts, and he is grateful for the chance he is being given.

loans.use: To pay for university fees.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
After graduating middle-school, Hellen decided to set up her own pastry business in Akpafu Mempeasem (near Hohoe). With over four years-worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. 

As a result, this loan will be used to help her to purchase more wheat flour, sugar, and oil to make her tasty pastries to sell. She aims to use the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a farmer ) with the upkeep of their house whilst ensuring that their seven children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more wheat flour, sugar, and oil to make her tasty pastries to sell.

loans.name: Benkadi   1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Benkadi 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à BOUGOURA, un des villages de la commune de YANGASSO cercle de SAN, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 5 eme prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  L’arachide  avec DJENEBA,  1 ère débout  de la gauche vers la droite avec foulard rose  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Kimparana, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 45 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of "Benkadi 1" are married women averaging 45 years of age and six children each, all living in traditional families in BOUGOURA, a village in Commune de YANGASSO, Cercle de SAN (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back.

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with DJENEBA, who is the standing first from the left and wearing a pink scarf in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase farm inputs, seeds, and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing to maintain 0.5 hectare. 

After the harvest, the produce will be sold to men and women customers in villages and in Kimparana. She plans on making a profit of 45,000 francs CFA at the end of the season. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, farm inputs, sundry equipment, and seeds

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth operates a business selling bracelets and necklaces in Akpafu Mempeasem (near Hohoe). Elizabeth is a widow with three children. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Elizabeth uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of bracelets and necklaces, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. As a middle-school graduate, Elizabeth understands the importance of education in improving social conditions, thus she plans to use the profits from her expanded enterprise to ensure that all her children remain in school.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of bracelets and necklaces.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is divorced and has three children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Mary is a successful businesswoman. She prepares and sells ‘Kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian staple dish that is made from corn dough and is wrapped in banana leaves) for a living. She normally sells her ‘Kenkey’ near Cape Coast. She has been actively involved in this business for about five years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Mary uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Mary will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is married with five children. She has received some schooling, up until the end of middle school. Currently, Cecilia sells provisions and produces palm oil in Soba (near Hohoe). She has been involved in this industry for about 14 years now. Her husband is a peasant farmer. Cecilia’s income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. 

Cecilia will use the loan to increase her existing levels of groceries and palm fruit. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Cecilia plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing levels of groceries and palm fruit.

loans.name: Larisa

texts.es:
Larisa es una persona que estudia por salir adelante y ser el día de mañana una gran profesional que pueda ser útil a la sociedad.
Ella estudia y trabaja, su meta es poder recibirse y también poder especializarse. Comenta que es un poco difícil estudia y trabajar, pero que lo hace por mejorar su estilo de vida.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de sus útiles , como ser libros, carpetas, copias y demás. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo, que le permitirá seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Larisa is studying to get ahead in life and to become a good professional in the future in order to be useful to the community.
On top of being a student she also works, and she wants to graduate as well as to specialize. She says that studying and working is a bit difficult but she does it to improve her standard of living.
The loan she is requesting will be used to pay for school materials such as books, folders, photocopies and other items. She is grateful for the chance she is being offered, as it will help her continuing getting ahead.

loans.use: To pay for school materials such as books, folders, photocopies

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Veronica is a widow and has three children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Veronica is a successful businesswoman who prepares and sells ‘gari,’ a traditional Ghanaian snack that is made from starched powdered cassava. She normally sells her gari in Akatakyiwa (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about three years. Veronica uses her income to provide for the entire family as the sole breadwinner. Veronica will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of cassava, thus helping her improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Veronica plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells and adapt to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of cassava, thus helping her improve her overall sales

loans.name: Rose Akwamoah

texts.en: Rose is a small-scale fish seller in Akpafu Mempeasem (near Hohoe). She has had some form of formal education as a junior high school graduate. She is married to a farmer and has four children. Rose has been working as a fish seller for close to five years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of fish to meet rising customers’ demand. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to develop her business further and ensure that all her children receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of fish to meet rising customers’ demand

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria vive junto con su familia en la hermosa ciudad de Paucartambo en el departamento del Cusco, ella tiene 50 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos a quienes saca adelante, ella alterna las actividades del hogar con la venta de granos secos y frutas entonces ella lleva al valle productos secos como por ejemplo cebada, trigo, maíz y cuando regresa trae frutas como por ejemplo piña, plátano y naranjas. Ya son varios años que se dedica a  este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Carmen” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar granos secos como maíz y cebada para incrementar el capital del negocio. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Victoria lives with her family in the beautiful city of Paucartambo, which is in the Department of Cusco. She is 50 years old and in a common-law relationship. Victoria has four children for whom she wants to move forward. She divides her time between the household activities and her business of selling dried grains and fruits. Victoria goes to the valley to offer dried products such as barley, wheat, and corn, and then returns home bringing fruits such as pineapples, bananas, and oranges. She has been in this business for several years and is doing very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

Victoria belongs to the Communal Bank “Mamacha Carmen”. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy dried grains, such as corn and barley, so that she can increase her business capital. Victoria appreciates and values this loan, so she promises to complete her monthly payments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to buy dried grains, such as corn and barley.

loans.name: Hermankono Diès 5 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Hermankono Diès 5 fait partie de la coopérative COOBADI et est située à Divo, une petite ville à l’est de la Côte d’Ivoire à environ 2 heures de route d’Abidjan. Le groupe est composé de 5 personnes. 
Marcelin a 29 ans et il est un membre du groupe Hermankono Diès 5. Il s‘occupe de 8 personnes dans son foyer. Cela fait 2 ans qu’il fait partie de la coopérative COOBADI et il a 3 hectares de cacao certifié. 

Grace au crédit, il va pouvoir acheter de l’engrais pour sa plantation. Ces produits vont lui permettre d’augmenter sa production et ainsi d’accroître ses revenus. 

Avec l’argent supplémentaire, il veut Créer une plantation de palmier à huile.
texts.en:
The group "Hermankono Diès 5" is part of the cooperative  Hermankono Diès 5 and is located in Divo, a town in eastern Cote d'Ivoire and about two hour's drive from Abidjan. The group is composed of five persons. 

Marcelin is 29 years old, and he is a member of the group  Hermankono Diès 5. He takes care of eight persons at home. He has been a part of the cooperative COOBAD for two years, and he has 3 hectares of certified cocoa.

Thanks to loans, he is going to be able to purchase some fertilizers for his plantation. These products will enable him to augment his production and thus to increase his revenues. 

With the additional money, he wants to establish an oil palm plantation.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is married to a carpenter and has three children. She uses her income to help her husband pay the household expenses as well as save for a rainy day. Margaret is a junior high school graduate and currently works as a seamstress in Akpafu Mempeasem, Hohoe. With over five years of experience in this trade, Margaret sees an opportunity to expand her enterprise further. However, she does not have the working capital necessary to increase her quantity of stock.  Her loan will be used to buy more linen, zippers and thread, indirectly helping her boost her overall sales. Margaret wants to make her business self-sustainable as soon as possible. As a result, she plans to channel the new profits from her expanded business back into her seamstress enterprise.

loans.use: to buy more linen, zippers and thread to boost her overall sales

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is divorced and has one child. Irene graduated from middle school to become an established businesswoman. She decided to use her technical knowledge gained in school to start a seamstress business in Soba (near Hohoe). She has been actively involved in this business for about 30 years. Irene uses her income to provide for the entire family. Irene will use the loan to purchase thread, zippers, linen and cloth to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Irene plans to diversify the type of products that she sells and adapt to customers' changing preferences.

loans.use: to purchase thread, zippers, linen and cloth

loans.name: Yasien

texts.en:
Yasien is a Palestinian man; he is a 22-year-old single man. For the past year, Yasien has had a grocery store selling different types of groceries. It has been a profitable project and a second source of income to the family, but also it needs more support to cover the costs. 

Yasien is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help cover the costs of purchasing the needed stock of basic groceries that customers often request and buy such as rice, sugar, canned food and milk. This will increase sales and increase the family's income. Yasien is looking in the future to expand his project to improve his income. 

The photo is of Ysaien in his grocery store.

loans.use: to pay the costs of purchasing a needed stock of basic groceries.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is involved in selling rice Akpafu Mempeasem, Hohoe. Her earnings are generally used to help her husband (who is a farmer) support their three children. She has been involved in selling rice for 15 years now. 

She plans on using her loan to purchase additional amounts of rice, thus helping her sell more due to increased inventory capacity. She aspires to use her profits, to both better market her rice enterprise and increase her existing working capital. She hopes that this strategy will allow her to expand her present customer base.

loans.use: to purchase additional amounts of rice, thus helping her sell more due to increased inventory capacity.

loans.name: Sinignessigui Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles avec une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans et 6 enfants, les sept femmes du groupe SINIGNESSIGUI habitent toutes dans le quartier Bougoula hameau de la ville de Sikasso (3ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de leurs activités professionnelles.  
Elles  font de la vente de savon, de riz, de la fabrication  et vente de soumbala. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe intègrent Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 11ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame MADOUSSOU, debout en deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 5 sacs de riz.  Elle s’approvisionne sur place à Bougoula et ensuite fait la vente à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Madame MADOUSSOU compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de  40.000  francs CFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge certains besoins du foyer
texts.en:
Most of them married in traditional families and averaging 45 years of age and six children each, the seven women of the group SINIGNESSIGUI all live in the Bougoula Hameau district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship and community and through their professional work. They buy and sell soap and rice, and they make and sell 'soumbala' (fermented seeds or beans used in cooking).

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their 11th solidarity loan cycle.

Ms. MADOUSSOU, who is standing second from the left in the photo, intends to use her loan to purchase 5 sacks of rice. She gets her supplies locally in Bougoula and then makes her sales to men and women customers. 

With this loan, Ms. MADOUSSOU plans making an average monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business and meeting certain household needs.

loans.use: to purchase rice

loans.name: Jakeline

texts.es:
Jakeline tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y vive en una casa alquilada junta su familia incluyendo su madre y hermana. Jakeline se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, para venderlo desde su casa y en forma ambulatoria por los mercados,  realizando este negocio desde hace 05  años contando con el apoyo de su esposo.
Le gusta su negocio pues le ha generado buenas ganancias además de conocer muy bien el negocio lo cual le da las facilidades de manejar bien sus ventas, por eso tiene planes de abrir una tienda comercial de venta de ropas.
Este será su primer préstamo con Kiva, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. 
Con el monto de 1000 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de más ropas de diversos modelos para vender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Jakeline is 26 years old and married.  She lives in a rented house with her family, which includes her mother and sister.  Jakeline sells clothes for women, men, and children.  She sells from her house and in an itinerant manner at the markets.  She has been in this business for five years, and she has her husband’s support.

She likes her business.  It has generated good earnings for her, and it has given her a good knowledge of the business.  This gives her the ability to manage her sales well.  Therefore, she has plans to open a commercial store selling clothes.

This will be her first Kiva loan.  She hopes for your collaboration in order to continue with her objectives.  She will use the 1,000 soles to buy more diverse types of clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more diverse types of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Las Almendras. Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal las Almendras tiene ocho integrantes, madres solteras con 15 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarias del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Estas mujeres se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal, en sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañia de sus pequeños hijos, y prepararles platos típicos como el “El indio Viejo” lamentablemente no pudieron estudiar por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar, pero se vieron obligadas a trabajar desde temprana edad. Por lo tanto lucha día a día para sacar adelante a sus familias. 
Concepción es la coordinadora del banco comunal, y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, café, fósforos, cigarros, jugos, gaseosas, detergente, jabón, leche, pan, huevos. Ella dedica unas 12 horas diarias a su negocio ofreciendo sus productos, actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El  banco comunal  las Almendra agradece la ayuda que lo inversionistas Kiva le brinda a apersonas  de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua, para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Las Almendras” (The Almonds) has eight members. They are single mothers who are responsible for 15 children among them. These women are originally from El Sauce, a place that is located in the northern part of the country. They are known as hardworking and responsible individuals who have the drive to succeed on a personal level. In their free time, they enjoy spending time with their young children and preparing traditional dishes such as “El Indio Viejo” (a Nicaraguan corn stew). Unfortunately, due to the lack of financial resources, they were not able to study. Instead, they were obligated to begin working at an early age. Therefore, they strive on a daily basis to provide for their families.

Concepción is the coordinator of this Communal Bank and has a store that is located in her home. She sells food products such as rice, beans, sugar, coffee, juices, sodas, milk, bread, and eggs, as well as matches, cigarettes, detergents, and soap. Concepción works approximately 12 hours a day at her business by offering these products. She operates her business with great pleasure. Her loan will be invested as operating capital to restock her business of buying and selling food products. In the not-so-distant future, she hopes to generate more income.

The Communal Bank “Las Almendras” appreciates the assistance from Kiva lenders to people who have limited resources and are from poor countries, such as Nicaragua, so that they can have a decent means of earning a living.

loans.use: to buy various products for her store.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 48-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and four children who are attending school. He has invested in land where cars can park all day long. He has two employees who help him serve customers. He is very happy as he is supporting his family well and the employees’ families as well, indirectly. Ahmad seeks to constantly expand his business. That’s why he is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l  to renovate the tents installed in the parking area so that the cars can be parked in a safe place with no threat of damage. In the future, he looks forward to borrowing more Kiva loans with the aim of enlarging his business further.

loans.use: renovate the tents in his parking lot

loans.name: Marquirivi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MARQUIRIVI” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Marcela es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de leche, venta de ganado, tienda de barrio, venta de queso, venta de tunta.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Marcela es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción y venta de queso; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por consejo de su familia al observar que contaba con un poco capital y sabía la técnica, decide comprar ganados para emprender su negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de su mercadería (compra de ganado) que adquirirá de las comunidades aledañas y posteriormente a la crianza elaborara los productos para su comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The “MARQUIRIVI” communal bank is beginning its first loan with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal of Copacabana. It is made up of nine members and is directed by a governing board, of which Marcela is the president. The businesses which the members of the communal bank run are varied and include: selling milk, selling cattle, running a local shop, selling cheese and selling freeze-dried potatoes. The loan which they get will benefit the small micro-businesses of which Marcela is a member. She says this is the first time she has joined Pro Mujer, following an invitation from a promoter of the institution who visited her at home. Currently she has a business producing and selling cheese; she says she started this business on the advice of her family as she had a small amount of capital and technical knowledge, so she decided to buy cattle to start her business. 

The loan she is asking for is to increase her stock (buying cattle) which she will source in the neighbouring communities and after rearing them she will produce products for sale.
