He likes working in the open because of the pure air he gets from the environment and he also feels satisfied with the income his work generates because it’s useful to pay basic expenses at home and for his children’s education although he would like to earn more.  He plans to expand the business and go into a new project planting cocoa beans because of the current boom this product is having locally.  

On this occasion he will request 1,000 soles and he’s grateful for the opportunity he’s being given to access the loan he needs in order to continue reaching his goals.  He will use the amount requested to buy organic manure for his banana crop.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Aiymbu

texts.ru: Айымбу, 60 лет, вдова, мать троих детей (1 сын и 2 дочери). Образование-высшее. Айымбу на протяжении 2 лет занимается строительным бизнесом, точнее выпуском шлакоблока, бизнес начала с 50000 сом (KGS). Айымбу имеет хороший практический опыт в строительстве. Благодаря своему усердию и терпению Айымбу имеет на сегодняшний день хорошие обороты в бизнесе. Также имеет небольшое хозяйство: 3 дойные коровы, и 10 овец. Ежемесячная прибыль ее семьи составляет 10000 сом (KGS). Дети взрослые, проживают отдельно. Материально помогает старший сын, который находится на заработках в Китае. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айымбу обратилась в Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100 000 сом (KGS) на покупку песка, цемента и красителей для производства шлакоблока. Доходы от кредита Айымбу планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Aiymbu is 60 years old, a widow and a mother of three children (one son and two daughters).  She has a higher education.  Aiymbu has been involved in a construction business, i.e. making cinder blocks, for two years.  She started the business with 50,000 som (KGS).  Aiymbu has a good practical experience in construction.  Thanks to her diligence and patience, today Aiymbu has a good turnover in the business.  She also has a small farm with three dairy cows and ten sheep.  The family's monthly profit amount to 10,000 som (KGS).  The children are grown and live separately.  The oldest son, who works in China, helps her financially.  In order to further develop her business, Aiymbu requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the Microfinance Bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy sand, cement and paint for making cinder blocks.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a further development of her business.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement and paint for making cinder blocks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current stock of fish and vegetables

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Rose is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling cooking ingredients in Akatakyiwa (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for four years. 

Rose is married and has six children. Her husband works as a carpenter. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. 

Rose will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of cooking ingredients, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Rose plans to further diversify the types of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of cooking ingredients, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: José Amado

texts.en: José has a small farm and is interested in renewable energy and sustainable farming practices, as demonstrated by the sacrifices he and his family have made to be able to send their daughter to study agricultural engineering. By installing a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, he and his family will more effectively take advantage of an available resource - the animal waste produced on their farm. They will feed their system with this animal waste to produce renewable biogas and a potent biofertilizer, increasing their independence from non-renewable, fossil-based LP gas and agrochemical fertilizer. This loan represents 45% of the total cost of their Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: To purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a Kubo Financiero client and this is his story.

Hello my name is Martin, I am 47 years old and have been married for the last 25 years, I live with my wife and we don´t have any children. I have been a car mechanic for most of my  life,  5 years ago I started selling spare parts to earn more money.  My father taught me how to fix cars, and then I became independent.  Its a small car shop in which me and my brother are the only workers.

My biggest accomplishment is owning a house and a business, my next goal is to grow my business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and refurbished my auto shop.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Guadalupe is a Kubo Financiero Client and this is her story:

My name is Guadalupe and I am 38 years old. I live with my husband and my two children in Mexico City, in a neighborhood called Iztapalapa. I have been in my business for 10 years. I sell different kind of stuff depending on the season. Sometimes I sell toys and clothes, and sometimes jewelry such as earrings, bracelets, necklaces, chains and rings made of gold.  I also sell coffee, chocolate, sandwiches and other meals on sundays for breakfast.

I will use this credit to buy gold bangles, chains and rings for my jewelry business. For my breakfast business I will use the credit to buy tuna and sugar in bulk because it is cheaper.  With this loan, I am hoping to expand my business and to gain higher profits. My biggest accomplishments are expanding my business, buying land and giving my two children a good education.

loans.use: to buy toys, jewelry and food in bulk

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista is a single mother with four children, three of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. 

Teopista operates a clinic in a shop that she rents. She has been in this business for three years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy vaccines, syringes, slups and other drugs. She earns additional income from selling fruit and vegetables. She works for seven days a week and works on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include price fluctuations in drugs and transportation. She aspires of educating her children to university level. 

She resides in rented house and the family has no access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent for her stall at the market and school fees.

loans.use: to buy vaccines and other drugs to sell in her clinic.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a single mother with six children, two of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. 

Margret sells cosmetics at the market and has been in this business for four years. She works for seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy weaves, relaxers, oils and shampoo. 

She aspires of owning a fully stocked stall of different types of cosmetics. She resides in her own house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include medication for the children and school fees.

loans.use: to buy relaxers, hair treatments, oils and shampoo to sell at the market.

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr: Aidée par 01 personne dans l’exécution de son activité, Adjovi âgée de 35ans vit avec son conjoint et leur enfant  de 02ans à Lomé. Pour aider ce dernier dans les charges du foyer, elle a démarré en 2011,  la vente des habits pour enfants, des pagnes, et autres produits divers dans une boutique. Son premier crédit l’aidera à s’approvisionner en marchandises afin de mieux répondre aux besoins de la famille. elle espère ouvrir une seconde boutique et assurer le bien être de la famille.
texts.en:
Adjovi, aged 35, lives with her husband and their two-year-old child in Lomé.  In order to help her husband cover the household expenses, she started her current activity in 2011.  She sells children's clothes, "pagnes" (colorful West-African fabrics) and other various products in a store.  One person helps her run the business.

This first loan will help her to buy a stock of merchandise in order to better meet her family's needs.  She hopes to open a second store and ensure the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes, children's shoes and other products.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia, who lives in Kampala, Uganda, is married and has two children. One of her children goes to school. She takes care of one additional family member. She operates a retail shop at the market. She has been in business for the last eight years. She works six days a week. Her other source of income is from rental houses. She has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy boxes of soap and bags of sugar, rice and flour. Her major challenges are seasonality and transportation. She lives in her own house, and her family has access to piped water and electricity. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a van to transport her merchandise to the market. Her major monthly expenses include medication and food.

loans.use: To buy boxes of soap.bag of sugar,rice and flour

loans.name: Shodigul

texts.ru: Шодигулю 46 лет, проживает в районе Шахритус. Она замужем и является матерью троих сыновей. Старшему сыну 25 лет и он студент, среднему 18 лет, он недавно окончил школу и младшему 12 лет, он еще учится в школе. Муж Шодигуль работает в энергетической компании. Сама Шодигуль в течение 3-х лет занимается торговлей. Она на рынке района имеет торговую точку, где продает детские одежды. Ей в деятельности помогает сестра, у которой большой опыт в торговом бизнесе. Шодигуль получает хорошую выручку, которую тратит и на семейные расходы и на продвижение бизнеса. Шодигуль берет кредит для
texts.en: Shodigul is 46 years old and lives in the Shahrituz district.  She is married and a mother of three sons.  The oldest son is 25 years old, and he is a student.  The middle is 18 years old, and he recently graduated from school, and the youngest is 12 years old, and he still attends a school.  Shodigul's husband works at an energy company.  Shodigul has been involved in sales for three years.  She has a retail outlet at a market, where she sells children's clothing.  Her sister, who has a lot of experience in the retail business, helps her with the business.  Shodigul gets a good profit that she spends on family expenses and on growing her business.  Shodigul is requesting this loan to purchase a selection of children's clothing in order to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase a selection of children's clothing in order to grow her business

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en: Nulu is married and has five children. All her children go to school. She also takes care of an additional family member. She sells charcoal at the market and has been in this business for three years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 UGX (Uganda shillings) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She earns additional income from selling bricks. She works seven days a week, on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She aspires to increase her sales so as to save and build rental houses. She would also like to buy a plot of land to make clay bricks, which are now in high demand. She resides in her own house. The family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent for her stall at the market and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty lives in Uganda Kampala and is married, with five children. All of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. 

Resty operates a salon at the market on retail basis. She has been in business for the last 11 years. She works seven days a week. She gets additional income from outside catering. 

She has requested from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) a loan of UGX 800,000 to buy hair treatments, oils, and relaxers for the salon. Her major challenges are seasonality and transportation. She lives in a rented house and her family has access to piped water and electricity. 

Resty's goal and aspiration is to have a fully-stocked salon, providing bridal services. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy hair treatments, oils, and hair relaxers for her salon.

loans.name: Rahima

texts.ru: Рахима с огромным сердцем доброты и прекрасной душой. Ей 30  лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Климат ее местожительство весьма благополучный для выращивания сельхоз культур, а также для скотоводства. Более 12  лет она занимается скотоводством. У нее есть в оборотном капитале 7 коровы. Она продает молоко своим соседям и соседи очень довольны от полученного натурального молочного продукта. Еще она продает скот, за которым она присматривалась в течение нескольких месяцев. На рынке у нее много клиентов. Рахима хочет провести мероприятие в семье, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для проведения мероприятия. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Rahima has a huge heart and a beautiful soul.  She is 30 years old, married and raising three children.  The climate in her locale is quite favorable for growing agricultural crops and also for animal husbandry.  She has been involved in animal husbandry for over 12 years.  She has seven cows in her working capital.  She sells milk to her neighbors, and the neighbors are very glad to have the natural milk product.  She also sells livestock that she looks after for several months.  She has many clients at a market.  Rahima wants to hold an event for the family, but does not have enough money for it.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 somoni to hold this event.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to hold a family event

loans.name: Cate

texts.en:
Cate is married with two children and both her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She sells charcoal at the market and has been in this business for two years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She gets additional income from selling snacks at a school in the neighborhood. She works seven days a week and works on a retail basis only. 

Cate's major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She is aspiring of buying a plot of land. She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include rent for her stall at the market and for her house.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is married and has five children, four of whom go to school. She also takes care of an additional family member. She sells charcoal at the market and has been in this business for five years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 UGX (Uganda shillings) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She receives additional income by selling snacks at a neighboring school. She works seven days a week, selling on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She aspires to increase her sales, so as to save and build rental houses. She resides in her own house. The family does not have access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent for her stall at the market and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ana Lorena

texts.es: Ana Lorena es una señora que ha trabajo en el mundo de la estética por mucho tiempo, actualmente tiene una pequeña empresa de estética y masajes. sin embargo con esto no ha podido lograr los ingresos necesarios para pagar las necesidades básicas de su familia. es por esto que solicita un préstamo de un millón de colones (1.000.000)para la compra de nuevos equipos y así poder crecer profesionalmente junto con su negocio y que los clientes se sienta más cómodos y mejor atendidos y así poder tener una calidad de vida mejor.
texts.en: Ana Lorena is a woman who has worked in the beauty world for a long time.  She currently has a small beauty salon and massage parlor.  However, she’s been unable with this to earn enough income to cover her family’s basic needs.  This is why she’s requesting a one-million colon loan to buy new equipment so she and her business can grow professionally and her customers will feel more comfortable and better cared for and thus she’ll be able to have better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy equipment and supplies.

loans.name: Akadi Group

texts.fr:
Mme ALIZETA est responsable du groupe AKADI. Mariée, elle est mère de quatre (04) enfants. Le plus âgé a 24ans et le moins âgés à 16 ans. Deux (02) vont à l’école. 
Mme vend du jus et de l’eau fraiche depuis 02 ans .Elle vend aussi des layettes maintenant. Elle s’approvisionne aux marchés de son secteur. Ses clients sont les habitants de son quartier. 
Elle veut s’acheter 01 sac de sucre, 01 sac de petit mil et 01 balle de laine.
 Elle veut renforcer son activité avec ses bénéfices. Mme ambitionne étendre les limites de son commerce et mieux scolariser ses enfants dans des meilleurs lycées.
texts.en:
Alizeta is the representative of the AKADI group.  She is married and the mother of four children.  Her oldest child is 24 years old, her youngest is 16.  Two of her children are in school.

Alizeta has been selling juices and cold water for two years.  She has also started to sell baby clothes.  She stocks up at the markets in her area and resells to residents of her neighborhood.

She wants to buy one bag of sugar, one bag of pearl millet and one ball of wool.

She plans to use her profits to boost her business.  Her goal is to expand her activity and to provide a better education for her children by sending them to better high schools.

loans.use: to buy one bag of sugar, one bag of pearl millet and one ball of wool.

loans.name: Miria

texts.en:
Miria is married with six children, five of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members who are orphans. She has been a poultry farmer for five years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy vaccines, poultry feed, and feeding utensils. She works from home seven days a week. She gets additional income from selling charcoal from home. 

Her major business challenges include diseases that affect her poultry and transportation. She is aspiring to expand production and build more rooms for her birds. She resides in the family house, which has electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, feeding the family and paying utility bills.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed, vaccines, and feeding utensils.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es: Natividad es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia ella tiene 53 años edad y tiene ochos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de verduras, granos secos y crianza de animales menores como cuyes, ella compra de diferentes agricultores de Paucartambo verduras como por ejemplo cebollas, zanahorias, repollo, habas, tomates y otros para luego venderlos en su puesto de venta de uno de los mercados de Paucartambo. Ya son varios años que se dedica a  este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Carmen” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar granos secos y verduras. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Natividad is a hardworking, enterprising, 53-year-old woman who supports her family; she has 8 children.  She works selling vegetables, dry grains and raising small animals like guinea pigs.  

She buys vegetables like onions, carrots, cabbage, lima beans, tomatoes and others from different farmers in Paucartmbo to then sell in her sales stand in one of Paucartambo’s markets.  She’s been in this business for several years now and does very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  

She belongs to the “Mamacha Carmen” communal bank and on this occasion needs the loan to buy dry grains and vegetables.  She’s grateful for and values the loan and commits to make her monthly payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy dry grains and vegetables.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married with two children, who both go to school. She takes care of two additional family members. 

Josephine has been in the business of selling second-hand clothes for three years. She works six days a week and sells on a retail basis. 

She resides in her own house. The family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include medication and school fees for the children.

Josephine has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO to buy a bale of second-hand clothes.  She aspires to own a fully stocked stall of clothing and bags and to build a rental house.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothing

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is married with two children and all her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She sells second-hand clothes and has been in this business for many years. She works from home six days out of every week and sells on retail basis. 

She has applied for a loan of 900,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy second-hand clothes.  She is aspiring to own a fully stocked stall of second-hand clothes and bags, and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and has no access to piped water. Her monthly expense includes rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy used clothes.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is married and has four children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of addition family members. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include paying for electricity  bills and school fees.

She sells charcoal from home and has been in this business for four years. She works seven days a week and works on retail basis only. Her major business challenge includes seasonality and transportation. She gets additional income from rental houses.

She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She is aspiring to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose lives in Uganda Kampala and is married with five children. All her children go to school. She does not have additional family members. She sells charcoal at the market on a wholesale basis. She has been in business for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week. Her other sources of income are from operating a bar and rental houses. She has requested from MCDT – SACCO a loan of 2,000,000 to buy bags of charcoal. Her major challenge is seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a truck for transporting charcoal from the village to the market. She lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity .Her major monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Maritza Marleny

texts.es:
Maritza tiene 47 años de edad, es madre de cinco hijos. Desde hace más de 10 años de experiencia en la sastrería con lo cual a salido adelante con sus 5 hijos de los cuales 3 de ellas están acompañadas.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para reparar su maquina de coser y para comprar material de costura para seguir trabajando. Con la inversión, podrá seguir elaborando costuras, sin perder a sus clientes y al mismo tiempo mejorar la calidad de vida junto a sus dos hijas que viven con ella.
Su sueño, es que su taller de costureria cresca cada días más para que sea estable, ya que es su unica fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Maritza, 47, is the mother of five children.  She has more than 10 years’ experience in tailoring with which she’s gotten ahead with her five children; three of them have spouses.

The loan she’s asking Fundación Campo for is to repair her sewing machine and to buy sewing supplies so she can continue working.  With the investment she’ll be able to continue sewing not losing customers and at the same time improve her quality of life and that of her two daughters that still live with her.

Her dream is that her sewing workshop grows more every day so that it will be stable since it’s her only source of income.

loans.use: to repair her sewing machine and to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge, tiene 41 años de edad, es casado, tiene 3 hijos y vive con su familia en una aldea del municipio de Protección, Santa Bárbara. El siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura. Cultiva café, maíz y frijoles, esta producción la vende en el mercado local de la zona. El préstamo que solicita es por 6,000 Lempiras y los va invertir en darle un buen mantenimiento a su finca de café, comprara fertilizantes y abonos para mejorar la producción. Su meta es mejorar la condición de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Jorge, 41, is married with three children; he lives with his family in a village in the municipality of Protección, Santa Bárbara.  He’s always worked in agriculture.  He grows coffee, corn and beans that he sells in the local market.  The loan he’s requesting is for 6,000 Lempiras that he’ll use to provide good maintenance for his coffee crop; he will buy fertilizer and manure to improve production.  His goal is to improve his family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Luz Maribel

texts.es: Luz, tiene 30 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos, ella vive con su familia en el Municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes.  Luz lleva varios años con su propia pulpería, en este negocio  vende granos básicos, refrescos, lácteos, churros, manteca, azúcar, pan, huevos, etc.  Al cual le dedica todo el día, ella tiene la ventaja de atender a su familia y al mismo tiempo su negocio. Ha decidido solicitar otro préstamo por 15,000 Lempiras, el cual es el quinto ciclo con ODEF donde ha podido mantener activo su negocio. Comprara manteca, frijoles, harina de maíz y otros productos de la canasta básica. Su meta es seguir con el negocio y sus préstamos  para poder vivir mejor con su familia.
texts.en:
Luz, 30, is married with three children; she lives with her family in Santa Cruz de Yojoa Municipality, Cortes.  Luz has had her own grocery store for several years.  She sells basic grains, soft-drinks, dairy products, packaged snacks, shortening, sugar, bread, eggs, etc. in it.  She spends all day there and has the advantage that she can care for her family and run the business simultaneously.  

She’s decided to request another loan for 15,000 Lempiras which will be her fifth ODEF cycle that has helped her keep her business active.  She will buy shortening, beans, corn flour and other basic staple gods.  Her goal is to stay in business and with her loans in order to live better with her family.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell, indirectly helping her boost her overall sales

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Although she has received no formal education, Esi is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling rice in Akatakyiwa (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for three years. Esi is married and has four children. Her husband works as a trader. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Esi wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, which will enable her to sell greater quantities of rice. In the long term, Esi plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of rice, which will enable her to sell more

loans.name: Yeredon (Se Connaitre) Group

texts.fr:
Yeredon est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Koulikoro de la ville de Koutiala qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans, sont mariées et ont en moyenne 5 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles  tels les habits, et des articles divers. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur douzième prêt de groupe. 
Awa est un membre du groupe Yeredon assise avec une shale jaune   en face de ces marchandises.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des  d’habits au pays Dogon et les tasses super à Lomé (la capitale Togolaise). Elle vend ses articles en détail et au comptant à la maison et au marché et à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Yeredon comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 175 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Awa  compte réaliser  195 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnel et augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
Yeredon is a group of women from the Koulikoro neighborhood of the city of Koutiala.  The members of the group are married women who live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives.  They are, on average, 40 years old with five children each.

This group of women sells clothes and other various goods.

In order to increase the size of their businesses, they have decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program and they are on their 12th group loan.

Awa is a member of the Yeredon group.  In the photo, she is the woman seated in front of her goods, wearing a yellow shawl.

She plans to use her loan to buy clothes in the Dogon country and large cups in Lomé (the capital city of Togo).  She resells her merchandise for cash, on a retail basis.  She sells from home and at the market to a diverse group of customers.

While the other members of the Yeredon group are each expecting to make an average profit of 175,000 CFA francs during this loan cycle, Awa is expecting to make 195,000 CFA francs.

In addition to repaying their loans, the members of the group will use part of their earnings to meet personal expenses and increase their businesses.

loans.use: to buy various goods such as clothes and large cups.

loans.name: Bah Oumou

texts.fr:
Madame Bah Oumou a 50 ans, mariée et mère de huit enfants. Elle réside avec son époux et leurs ses enfants à Hamdallaye Extension, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer à l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle s’est initiée à l’activité de teinture et vente de bazins qu’elle a appris depuis plus de vingt années auprès de sa grande. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle (composée essentiellement des voyageurs et des routiers) pour la qualité de ses articles et prestations.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ sept années. Elle est présentement à son septième prêt individuel, tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement rembourser.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                
Ce septième prêt lui permettra d’acheter 3 pièces de bazins blancs “Riche Hollandais”, 10 boîtes de teintures de couleurs différentes et 10 paquets de soudes caustiques . Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako mais aussi à Sikasso auprès des grands commerçants avant de les mettre en couleur et ensuite les revend au comptant et sur commande
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Madame Bah Oumou is 50, married and the mother of eight children. She lives with her husband and their children in Hamdallaye Extension, one of the populous districts of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

Not having been able to succeed in school due to socio-economic reasons, she got into dyeing and selling damask cloth, a business she learned more than 20 years ago from her older (sister). She is much esteemed by her customers (composed essentially of travelers and transporters) for the quality of her wares and her service. 

Wishing to better satisfy her ever-growing clientele she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso around seven years ago. She is now on her seventh individual loan, with all preceding loans correctly reimbursed. 

This seventh loan will permit her to buy three lengths of white damask of the "rich Dutch" brand, 10 boxes of dyes in different shades, and 10 packets of caustic soda. She buys her wares in Bamako but also in Sikasso, from big merchants, before doing the dyeing and then selling the cloth for cash, on order. 

She expects to make a monthly profit, with this loan, of 100,000 F CFA which will be essentially used to grow her working capital, contribute to family expenses, and pay the interest on her loan.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for dyeing cloth.

loans.name: Aidah

texts.en:
Aidah lives in Kampala Uganda. She is single with three children and two of her children go to school. She takes care of other additional family members. 

She sells second-hand shoes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last 5 years. She works six days a week. She has no other source of income. 

She has requested from MCDT–SACCO a loan of 500,000 UGX to buy  bales of used shoes. Her major challenge is seasonality and transportation. She lives in a rented house and her family has access to electricity and has no access to piped water. Her goal and aspiration is to open up another stall selling first-hand shoes and also build a house. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy   more bales of used shoes.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children and two of her children go to school. She does not have additional family members. 

She sells fruits and vegetables at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last 15 years. She works six days a week. 

She has requested from MCDT–SACCO a loan of 400,000 to buy a box of tomatoes, onions, pineapples, watermelon, and cabbages. Her major challenge is seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to build rental houses. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy a box of tomatoes, onions, pineapples, watermelon, and cabbages.

loans.name: Sohibjon

texts.ru:
Сохибчон молодой житель района Дж.Руми. Ему 26 лет. Женат, но детей пока не имеет. Сохибчон живет у родителей. Его мать работает медсестрой в больнице, а отец является помощником главы джамоата. У Сохибчона среднее образование. Он работает обычным продавцом в магазине. Однако сейчас Сохибчон хочет заняться собственным бизнесом. В его местности считается прибыльным выращивание крупно-рогатого скота. Сохибчон планирует выращивать мясное поголовье. У него на руках есть сбережение в размере 800 TJS, а также 200 взяток сено. По словам Сохибчона он имеет все условия для разведения скота. 
Сохибчон просит кредит в размере 2000 долларов США. На сумму кредита и сбережения он собирается купить 5-голов коров и телят и жмыха для начала бизнеса откорм-продажа скота.
texts.en: Sohibjon is a young man living in the Rumi District of Tajikistan. He is 26 years old. He is married but has no children. Sohibjon lives with his parents. His mother works as a nurse at a hospital, and his father is an assistant to the head Jamoat (local Tajikistani administrator). Sihobjon has completed his secondary education. He works as a shop assistant. However, now Sihobjon wants to begin his own business. In his area raising cattle is considered profitable. Sihobjon plans to raise beef cattle. He has 800 Tajikistani Somoni and 200 units of hay. In his words, Sihobjon he has everything needed for breeding cattle. Sihobjon is asking for a loan of $2000 U.S. Dollars. With the sum total of the loan and savings, he is going to buy five cows, calves, and feed, to begin a business fattening and selling cattle.

loans.use: To purchase five head of cattle, calves, and feed to begin a business raising cattle.

loans.name: Zalika

texts.en:
Zalika is married with three children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members.

She sells green bananas and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. She gets additional income from rental houses. She works at the market seven days a week and works on retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation.

She is aspiring to sell on a wholesale basis and also to open up another stall for different types of food. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her monthly expenses include rent for her stall at the market.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 45-year-old Abibatu from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married with three children between the ages of 7 years and 18 years. Her children are currently attending school. She started a business to get her daily survival for her family.
 
Abibatu runs a cookery business. She sells cooked food at her house, and she has been running this business since 2005. She works in the business from 4:30 and she will not rest until the food is finished. Abibatu says that the main challenge to her business is the problem of price control in the market.

Abibatu has requested a loan in order to buy food commodities like cooking seasonings, oil and rice. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children. In the future, she plans to own a big cookery shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy food commodities like cooking seasonings, oil and rice

loans.name: Gulkhan

texts.ru: Гулхан, 30 лет, замужем, имеет 1 ребенка (1 дочь). Образование-высшее. Работает врачом -реаниматологом в местной больнице. Семья у Гулхан очень дружная и трудолюбивая. В поисках дополнительных доходов для своей семьи, Гулхан решила дополнительно заняться разведением скота. Супруг помогает по хозяйству. Гулхан более 5 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с 7000 сом (KGS), благодаря ее терпению и трудолюбию на сегодняшний день она получает ежемесячную прибыль от хозяйства, в сумме 5000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве имеет 2 дойные коровы, 8 овец. В целях увеличения поголовья скота Гулхан обратилась в  микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом, в сумме 120 000 сом (KGS)  на покупку  коров для дальнейшего разведения. На доходы от кредита Гулхан хочет увеличить поголовье скота и добиться стабильного финансового достояния.
texts.en: Gulkhan is 30 years old, married and has one child - a daughter.  She has a higher education.  She works as an intensive-care doctor at a local hospital.  Gulkhan's family is very friendly and hardworking.  In search of an additional income for her family, Gulkhan decided to also get involved in breeding livestock.  Her husband helps her with the business.  Gulkhan has been involved in animal husbandry and farming for over five years, having started this business with 7,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her patience and hard work, today she earns a monthly profit from the business in the amount of 5,000 som (KGS).  The business contains two dairy cows and eight sheep.  In order to increase livestock headcount, Gulkhan requested a loan in the amount of 120,000 som (KGS) from the Microfinance Bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy cattle for raising.  Gulkhan wants to use the earnings from the loan to increase the livestock headcount and achieve a stable financial situation.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Sady

texts.es: Sady es una señora muy esforzada, ella desea hacer crecer su negocio por medio de venta de productos como blusas, sandalias bisutería y zapatos. es por ello que solicita un préstamo de un millón de colones (1.000.000) para la compra de la mercadería y así poder tener mas variedad para vender. Para ella es importante este préstamo porque le ayudará a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia
texts.en: Sady is a hard-working lady, she wants to grow her business through selling products such as blouses, sandals, jewelry, shoes.  This is why she requests a loan for 1 million Costa Rican Colones (1,000,000 CRC) to buy merchandise and be able to have more variety to sell.  For her, this loan is important because it will improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes for sale.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 55 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo. Él es electricista de profesión, posee 20 años de experiencia; aprendió junto a su papá, y le motivaba lo que el papá hacia fue entonces cuando se fue metiendo de lleno a realizar esta actividad, a tal grado que no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, su papá no le daba importancia al estudio, entonces en la actualidad su experiencia en la actividad que realiza es un medio de subsistir en el día a día él y su familia.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar materiales eléctricos tales como: cables, rosetones, tomas eléctricos, anclas, luces de diferentes tipos, debido a que adquiere contratos grandes y necesita invertir gran cantidad por lo cual estima que el crédito le será de mucho beneficio.

Él manifiesta que la necesidad mas grande que será satisfecha es  poder contar con el recurso económico, para adquirir todos los materiales de un solo y de esa manera no tener que estar viajando seguido hasta la ciudad y también al comprar por cantidades mayores podrá optar a un mejor precio en los productos.

Desea, ampliar su base de clientes, ya que hay trabajos que no puede  realizarlos por falta de recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Jorge, 55, is married with a son.  He’s an electrician by profession.  He has 20 years’ experience having learned from his father.  He was motivated by what his father did and gradually got into this activity full-time to such an extent that he was unable to go to school.  His father didn’t give much importance to schooling.  Therefore, his experience in the activity he does is his and his family’s source of support.

The loan he’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy electrical supplies like: cables, sockets, plugs, switch boxes and assorted light bulbs because he gets big contracts and needs to invest large amounts so he believes the loan will be very beneficial.

He states that the biggest need that will be met will be being able to count on economic resources to buy all the materials at once so that he doesn’t have to be traveling often to the city and also by purchasing in larger amounts he will be able to opt for better prices for the products.  He wants to expand his client base because there are projects available he’s been unable to do for lack of economic resources.

loans.use: to buy electrical supplies.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.es: Jacqueline es una mujer muy luchadora, ella tiene un pequeño negocio de repostería y panadería. necesita comprar un horno nuevo, ya que el actual se quemó y no ha podido vender la cantidad de productos necesarios para mantener a su familia. necesita de un préstamo por un millón de colones (1.000.000) para la compra de un nuevo horno y de utensilios. con esto va a poder sacar adelante su negocio y a su familia y asi seguir creciendo junto con su negocio.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is a very hardworking woman; she has a small bakery and pastry shop.  She needs to buy a new oven because her current one burned and she’s been unable to sell the amount of products needed to support her family.

She needs a one-million colon loan to buy a new oven and tools.  With this she’ll be able to move the business and her family forward thus continuing to grow alongside her business.

loans.use: to buy an oven and baking tools.

loans.name: Godeberthe

texts.en: Godeberthe is 55 years old. She sells electrical wires and many more equipment for electricity. With this loan, she would like to buy more electricity equipment for resale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: To buy more electrical equipment for sale

loans.name: Conchan  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
Conchan es un grupo de crédito que esta formado por 7 mujeres y 1 hombre quienes viven por los alrededores de la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, lugar que tiene una geografía accidentada, su clima es frió, sus tierras fértiles le dan la oportunidad a su población de dedicarse a la agricultura, crianza de animales y muchos laboran en la ciudad en el ejercicio de varios trabajos, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora Rosa Elvira, es una socia fundadora del grupo de Crédito Conchan, le gusta la compartir con sus amigas y compañeras, quienes tienen un mismo objetivo el cual es salir en adelante con sus familias.

La Señora Rosa Elvira tiene 55 años, es divorciada pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos, cinco de ellos son casados y viven independientes, sus dos hijos solteros trabajan y le  económicamente, la casa en la que vive es propia.

Doña Rosa Elvira se dedica a la agricultura, lo que cosecha lo utilizada para su hogar y para la venta, también cría cuyes, cerdos, gallinas, conejos y ganado. Desde muy joven sus padres le enseñaron el arte de tejer sombreros de paja toquilla. 

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos, cuyes y alimento para todos sus animales. 

Su meta es tener más animales de mejor calidad.

En la foto se encuentra una señora con chompa celeste que no pertenece al grupo de socias.
texts.en:
The Conchan communal bank is comprised of seven women and one man.  They live around the Valle parish in Cuenca.  The place has jagged geography and a cold climate.  Its fertile land gives its inhabitants the opportunity to farm and raise animals.  Many of them work in the city doing various jobs.  They still maintain the culture and traditions of their villages.

Rosa Elvira is a founding member of the Conchan communal bank.  She likes sharing with her friends and colleagues.  They have the same objective, which is to get ahead with their families.  Rosa Elvira, age 55, is divorced.  However, she and her husband had seven children.  Five of them are married and live independently.  Her two single children work and help her financially.  She lives in her own house.

Rosa Elvira is a farmer.  She uses what she harvests for her household and for sale.  She also raises guinea pigs, pigs, chickens, rabbits, and cattle.  When she was very young her parents taught her how to weave straw hats.

She will use her new loan to buy pigs, guinea pigs, and feed for all of her animals.  Her goal is to have more animals that are better quality.

There is a lady in with a light blue jacket in the photo, and she is not a member of the group.

loans.use: to buy pigs, guinea pigs, and feed for all of her animals.

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine is involved in selling cocoa beans in Dafonu (near Hohoe). His earnings are generally used to help his wife support their six children. He has been involved in selling cocoa beans for 26 years. 

He plans on using his loan to purchase additional cocoa beans, and the increased inventory capacity will help him sell more. He aspires to use his profits, to both better market his cocoa bean enterprise and increase his working capital. He hopes that this strategy will allow him to expand his present customer base.

loans.use: to purchase additional cocoa beans, and the increased inventory capacity will enable him to sell more

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira is a 55-year-old, widowed mother of five children for whom she sacrificed her whole life in order to provide them with the best living since her husband passed away 23 years ago.

Samira works from her house as a tailor. She makes clothes and curtains. Her wide experience in this domain provided her with customers' trust and support. She worked hard to increase her customers, through the good quality of products she makes and her competitive prices.

Samira works hard to develop her business. In fact, she dreams of opening her own separate shop outside her house to provide her family members with the privacy they need, but unfortunately her financial situation isn't enough to take such a step forward.

A step forward was accomplished by Samira when she acquired a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, to buy a newly developed sewing machine (Singer brand), to make her work faster, easier, and with a better finishing quality. This will improve her final touch and will please her customers.

Samira will continue to dream of opening her tailoring and clothes-selling shop, to move out of her small bedroom, and to expand her working area.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine (Singer brand).

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Alberta is an entrepreneur specializing in selling rice in Akatakyiwa (near Cape Coast) for the past three years. Married to a taxi driver and the mother of one child, Alberta's profits normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and their child's school fees.

Alberta will use this loan to purchase more rice to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to diversify her line of products to better meet customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase more rice for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cassava, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales

loans.name: Benkadi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI II sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  NIABOUGOU, un des villages de la commune de Niena dans la 3ème région administrative du Mali : SIKASSO. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur  deuxième  prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec  BARAKISSA S  debout au milieu. 
Avec son prêt,  elle compte acheter les frais de labour, 2 sacs d’engrais et 11 kg de semence d’arachide pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 110.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi II group are married women who, on average, are 42 years old and have five children. They all live in polygamous families in Niabougou, one of the villages in Niena commune in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

The group is collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their farming during the rainy season. They are on their second loan with the institution, and their previous loan has been repaid.

Barakissa S, standing in the middle [of the photo], grows groundnuts. With her loan, she plans to buy two bags of fertilizer and 11 kilograms of groundnut seed and to pay the costs of labor to cultivate one hectare of land.

After the harvest, the crops are sold in the village and in Sikasso to customers who are men and women.

Barakissa S hopes to earn 110,000 francs CFA per harvest. These earnings will allow her to pay back her loan and to also help her husband with the everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds and to pay for labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks for resale

loans.name: Benkadi Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe   BENKADI III sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  NIABOUGOU, un des villages de la commune de Niena dans la 3ème région administrative du Mali : SIKASSO. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur  deuxième  prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec  DJENEBA  debout en deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les frais de  labour, 2 sacs d’engrais et 9 kg de semence d’arachide pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 100.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi III group are married women who, on average, are 41 years old and have four children. They all live in polygamous families in Niabougou, one of the villages in Niena commune, Sikasso, third administrative region in Mali. 

The group is collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso so they can better carry out their farming during the rainy season. They are on their second loan with the institution, and their previous loan was repaid correctly.

Djeneba, standing second from the right in the photo, grows groundnuts. With her loan, she plans to buy two bags of fertilizer and nine kilograms of groundnut seed and to pay the cost of labor to cultivate one hectare of land.

After the harvest, she crops are sold in the village and in Sikasso to men and women customers.

Djeneba hopes to earn 100,000 francs CFA per harvest. These earnings will allow her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband with the everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds and to pay for labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of maize which to improve her ‘Kenkey’ production capacity

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras - Chilca Group

texts.es:
Nancy es una de las socias del Grupo Mujeres Emprendedoras, conformado por  8 personas en su totalidad mujeres muy trabajadoras y entusiastas.
Nancy tiene 35 años, es el único sustento para su hijo de 6 años, su padre y para sus hermanos. 
Ella es una de las socias más antiguas en el grupo, trabaja con “Edaprospo” más de 2 años, y  siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos.
Nancy tiene una tienda de abarrotes, donde vende azúcar, arroz, leche, dulces, regalos, etc., ella dice que sus principales clientes son sus vecinos y que la prefieren por que atiende más de 10 horas en su negocio.
El préstamos que solicitó lo usará para la compra de mercadería por mayor (arroz, azúcar, leche, dulces,etc.), y así mejorar sus ganancias, mejorando la calidad de vida de sus seres queridos.
Nancy se encuentra muy feliz y contenta por el apoyo que le brinda los inversionistas de KIVA y dice: “Que tengan confianza en nosotros para seguir adelante en nuestro trabajo, Gracias”.
Nancy viste una chompa guinda y es la primera persona de la izquierda.* En la parte superior se puede ver a la señora Angélica, presidenta del grupo, que no pudo llegar para esta reunión.
texts.en:
Nancy is one of the members of the “Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Enterprising Women) group consisting of 8 people, all women, who are very hardworking and enthusiastic.  Nancy is 35-years-old and the only source of support for her six-year-old son, her father and her siblings.

She is one of the longest-standing members of the group and has worked with Edaprospo for more than two years; she’s always been punctual with her payments.

Nancy has a grocery store where she sells sugar, rice, milk, candy, gifts, etc.  She says her main customers are neighbors who prefer her; she works more than 10 hours daily in her store.

She will use the requested loan to buy merchandise like rice, sugar, milk, candy, etc. at wholesale to improve profits and improve her loved ones’ quality of life.

Nancy is very happy and glad for the support Kiva lenders provide and she says: “May you trust us so that we can continue forward with our work.  Thank you.”

Nancy is wearing a maroon sweater and is first from the left.

*Angélica, group president, appears in the inserted photo above; she was unable to attend this meeting.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Saodatkhon

texts.ru: Саодатхон 24 года. Она замужем и имеет двухлетнюю дочь и годовалого сына. Саодатхон со своей семьей проживает в селе района Шахритус. В данный момент ее мужа нет, он находится на заработках за пределами страны. Вместе с ними также живет сестра мужа, которая присматривает за детьми, когда Саодатхон на работе. Саодатхон вот уже два года как занимается торговлей. Она на местном рынке продает детскую и подростковую одежду. Саодатхон по характеру скромная, трудолюбивая сельская женщина, имеющая хорошее отношение с людьми. Чтобы увеличить товарооборот Саодатхон обратилась за кредитом. Она хочет купить разнообразный ассортимент сезонной детской и подростковой одежды на продажу.
texts.en: Saodatkhon is 24 years old.  She is married and has a two-year-old daughter and a one-year-old son.  Saodatkhon and her whole family live in a village in the Shahrituz district.  At the present time, she does not have a husband, because he works abroad.  Her husband's sister also lives with them and looks after the children when Saodatkhon is at work.  Saodatkhon has been involved in sales for two years.  She sells children's and teenage clothing at a local market.  Saodatkhon is a humble and hardworking village woman, who treats people well.  She requested a loan in order to increase her goods turnover.  She wants to purchase a varied selection of seasonal children's clothing for resale.

loans.use: purchase a varied selection of seasonal children's clothing for resale

loans.name: Jekafo 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  JEKAFO 5 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TIOLA, un des villages de la commune de Niena dans la 3ème région administrative du Mali : SIKASSO. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec   SOGONA assise au milieu. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour, les semences  et les engrais  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 100.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group known as JEKAFO 5 are married women with an average age of 44, four children, and all live in polygamous families in Tiola,  one of the villages of the municipality of Niena in the third administrative region of Mali: Sikasso. 

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to succeed with their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their sixth loan with the institution, the preceding loans having been correctly reimbursed. 

Sogona, sitting in the middle, cultivates peanuts. With her loan she intends to pay for plowing and buy seeds and fertilizer to cultivate one hectare. Her produce is sold at the level of the village and in Sikasso, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. 

She expects to make a profit of 100,000 F CFA each season. This profit will permit her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, seeds and pay for plowing.

loans.name: Yemalin Femi 5 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement YEMALIN FEMI 5 est composé de seize personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Florentine est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour une troisième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Florentine est âgée de 29 ans et est mariée à un certain Florentin. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un est scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Florentine et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de sa famille, Florentine vend depuis neuf ans, des pâtes alimentaires et des sacs de blé vides de façon ambulante et dans un marché du Bénin. Florentine s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Florentine et les autres membres du groupement YEMALIN FEMI 5 sollicitent un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité. Les deux prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group known as Yemalin Femi 5 is made up of 16 persons who live in the same district. The leader of the group, Florentine, is the woman with her hand raised in the photo. Wishing to raise the level of their businesses so as to better cope with their customers' demand, this group is asking for their third loan from Alidé. 

Florentine is 29 years old and married to Florentin. The couple have two children, of whom one is enrolled in school and both are in their care. Florentine and her husband live together with their children and share in providing for the family. 

In order to contribute to the various needs of her family, Florentine has been hawking pasta  and empty wheat sacks on foot  and selling the goods in a market for nine years. She buys her supplies in a market in Benin. 

Wishing to grow their businesses and better satisfy their clientele, Florentine and the other members of the group called Yemalin Femi 5 are asking for a third loan from Alidé. Their ambition is to expand their activities. The two prior loans have been correctly reimbursed.

loans.use: to buy empty wheat sacks and pasta.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia, ella tiene 49 años edad y tiene cinco hijos, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de queso, ella compra sus quesos de la ciudad de Sicuani para luego venderlo en la ciudad Paucartambo. Ya son varios años que se dedica a  este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Carmen” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mas quesos.  

Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Elvira’s a hardworking, enterprising woman who supports her family.  She’s 49-years-old and has five children.  She works buying and selling cheese.  She buys the cheese in the city of Sicuani and then sells it in the city of Paucartambo.  She’s been in this business for several years and does very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  She belongs to the “Mamacha Carmen” communal bank and on this occasion needs the loan to buy more cheese.  She is grateful for and values the loan and commits to make her monthly payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy more cheese.

loans.name: Jesica

texts.es: Jesica una joven trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante, ella tiene 23 años edad y es soltera, ella trabaja en una entidad del estado en el área de gerencia municipal pero requiere el préstamo para uso personal, ella estudio la carrera técnica de analista de sistemas entonces el dinero del préstamo es para pagar el trámite para su graduación, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Carmen” y agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Jesica’s a young, hardworking entrepreneur who is getting ahead.  She’s 23-years-old, single and employed by a government agency in city management but she needs the loan for personal use.  She studied the technical career of systems analyst and will use the money from the loan to pay her graduation fees.  She belongs to the “Mamacha Carmen” communal bank and she’s grateful for and values the loan and commits to make her monthly payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to pay graduation fees.

loans.name: Trancito

texts.es: Trancito,  tiene 45 años de edad, es Madre soltera, vive con  sus dos hijos en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Ella tiene su propio negocio desde hace 4 años con venta de mercadería como ser ropa y Sandalias para damas y para niños. Anteriormente trabajaba en una maquila y allí comenzó su negocio. El préstamo que Trancito solicito es por L.5,000,  el cual lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para el negocio  como ser ropa, sandalias y otros. Con este préstamo va poder comprar a mejores precios y mejor mercadería para su negocio. Su plan es que sus hijos vivan mejor y que puedan estudiar.
texts.en: Trancito, 45, is a single mother living with her two children in Coloma, Cortes.  She’s had her own business for four years selling merchandise like clothes and sandals for women and children.  She used to work in an assembly plant and started her business there.  The loan Trancito is requesting is for 5,000 Lempiras that she’ll use to buy merchandise like clothes, sandals and others, for her business. She will be able to buy better merchandise at better prices for her business with this loan.  Her plan is that her children live better and be able to attend school.

loans.use: to buy women's and children's clothes and sandals.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es: Florencia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante, ella tiene 28 años edad y tiene un hijo, ella tiene un pequeño restaurante o pollería donde prepara ricos plato de comida y le va muy bien entonces en esta oportunidad ella requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como por ejemplo pollos, carne, papas, verduras y otras cosas más, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Carmen” y agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Florencia’s a hardworking, enterprising mother who is getting ahead.  She’s 28-years-old and has a son.  She has a small restaurant or chicken shop where she prepares delicious dishes; she does very well and on this occasion needs the loan to buy more supplies like chickens, meat, potatoes, vegetables etc. She belongs to the “Mamacha Carmen” communal bank and she’s grateful for and values the loan and commits to make her monthly payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like chickens, meat, potatoes, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Budensiana

texts.en: Budensiana is 47 years old. She sells foodstuffs and has spent fifteen years in the business. With the loan, she would like to buy more foodstuffs for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo en el departamento del Cusco y vive junto con su familia en esta hermosa ciudad, él tiene 50 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos a quienes saca adelante, él se dedica a la venta de combustible de forma artesanal, él tiene cilindros y baldes donde guarda la gasolina y petróleo y el negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio. Ya son varios años que se dedica a  este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, él pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Carmen” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más combustible. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Julio was born in the city of Paucartambo, department of Cusco and lives with his family in this beautiful city, he is 50 years old and is in a common law relationship with three children to get ahead, he sells fuel, he has cylinders and buckets where she stores the gasoline and oil, the business is located in his home.  He has done this for several years and does well thanks to the effort he puts into his work, he belongs to the community bank "Mamacha Carmen" and this time he needs the loan to buy more fuel.  He is thankful and values the loan and commits to make the monthly repayments with much responsibility.

loans.use: to buy more fuel

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Araba did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. A divorced mother of three, she has been selling palm oil in Akatakyiwa (near Cape Coast) for about 12 years, using all of her income to provide for her family.

Araba will use this loan to purchase more palm oil to improve her overall sales. Araba wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all of her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Aspeed Group

texts.en:
The featured borrower of Aspeed Group, Eufronio, along with his other group members, is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. They have been friends since they arrived to work in Lebanon in order to better support their families.

Eufronio is a 52-year-old married father of six children who works as a chef in a restaurant to provide his family with a better income. Pictured on the far left, he will use his loan portion to help pay for his children's university tuition fees back in The Philippines.

The other group members, Ruel and Joel, are pictured in the middle and the right respectively.

loans.use: pay for his children's university fees in The Philippines

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 23 years old. She sells local beer and has been in the business for four years. She would like to buy more local beer to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy more local beer to sell

loans.name: Henry Javier

texts.es: Henry, a sus 33 años de edad es un hombre soltero, padre de 2 hijos de 2 y 3 años. Toda su vida ha vivido en el campo y fue allí donde aprendió a realizar todas las actividades del campo, como la agricultura y el cuidado de animales. Él nació en una familia humilde, pero a pesar de ello no se desmotiva y cada día lucha para conseguir el sustento para sus dos hijos y la familia. Actualmente se dedica a trabajar en su pequeña granja todos los días de la semana, se encarga de criar y vender gallinas criollas y así obtiene el sustento diario para su hogar. Henry solicita el crédito con el fin de comprar 300 gallinas criollas, para criarlas, engordarlas y luego venderlas, y así poder obtener ganancias para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y lograr cumplir su principal sueño que es tener una de las mejores granjas del municipio y poder mejorar su calidad de vida y brindarle un mejor bienestar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Henry, at 33 years old, is single and the father of two children, who are two and three years old. He has lived in the countryside for his whole life, and it was there that he learned how to do farming activities like agriculture and caring for animals. He was born to a humble family, but nevertheless he is motivated and fights every day to support his two children and his family. 

He currently works at a small barn every day of the week. He is in charge of raising and selling free-range chickens, and this is how he makes his daily earnings to support his family. Henry is asking for this loan in order to buy 300 free-range chickens. He will raise them, fatten them up and then sell them. This way, he will be able to keep investing in his business and to achieve his main dreams, which are to have one of the best farms in the district, and to improve his quality of life and provide more for his children.

loans.use: to buy 300 free-range chickens.

loans.name: Kuña Aty El Triunfo Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Aty El Triunfo está en su ciclo número 3. Ellas hacen la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para poder conocer en qué situación se encuentran ellas, donde 3 de estas mujeres están con un ingreso muy bajo.
Adelaida es una de estas mujeres, quien también es la presidenta del grupo, ella es una persona que incentiva a sus compañeras a seguir creciendo, mientras que ella al mismo tiempo hace su propio trabajo. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de segunda mano, y con su esfuerzo está saliendo adelante.
Pide esta ayuda para poder comprar prendas de segunda mano y de esa forma poder seguir dando a sus clientes lo que piden. Agradece esta oportunidad que recibe, que le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
The Kuña Aty El Trifunfo group is in its third loan cycle. The women have participated in a poverty elimination survey in order to better understand the situation in which they live. All three members receive a very low income. 

Adelaida is one of these women and is also president of the group. She is a person that motivates her fellow borrowers to continue growing while she carries out her own work. She makes a living selling secondhand clothing and is getting ahead with her own efforts. 

She is requesting this support in order to buy secondhand clothing so that she can continue giving her customers what they want. She is thankful for the opportunity that she is receiving because it will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothing to sell.

loans.name: Avetik

texts.en:
Avetik is young farmer, aged 27. He lives with his parents in the city of Gavar, which is in Gegharkuni region. After having passed his military service, for several years Avetik did construction work in the Russian Federation. Two years ago, he came back to his native city and became engaged in farming, together with his father. At the same time, he continued to do construction work, by order.

On their farm, they keep two cows, two bulls, thirty sheep, and two piglets. Avetik’s mother perfectly makes cheese, butter, and macun (Armenian national dairy product) from milk, which she sells right from their house. Avetik says that since they all work together, all difficulties and problems of farming are solved easily and cleverly. 

Avetik plans to buy several lambs, a cow, and a lot of animal fodder. He will be very grateful, if support from Kiva lenders will enlarge his income and give him new ideas of farming for the future.

loans.use: to buy several lambs, a cow, and a lot of animal fodder.

loans.name: Diane

texts.en: Diane is 27 years old. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for seven years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas and potatoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy a motorbike which will be used for transportation.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and potatoes for sale

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en: Angelique is 27 years old and the mother of three children. For the past five years she has sold sorghum and beans. She is applying for a 400,000 RWF loan through Urwego to buy more sorghum and beans to sell. She will use her profits to buy a cow that will provide milk for the family.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum and beans to sell.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La señorita  Silvia es una joven de 23 años, es soltera y vive todavía con sus padres, el año pasado termino su carrera universitaria siendo Licenciada en Ciencias Contables.
La señorita  Silvia tiene un negocio de ropería,  artículos de bijouterie y joyas de platas desde hace 4 años, cuando empezó su estudio universitario, monto su propio negocio en el centro de la ciudad alquilando un salón comercial ayudada por su papa que le dio el capital inicial y luego fue creciendo con el tiempo ya que fue aplicando sus conocimientos y así progresar cada día en su negocio.-  
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de ropas como pantalones, blusas, remeras, carteras, cadena, pulsera, anillos, ropa interior y así poder cubrir los pedidos que tiene y por ende mejorar sus ingresos.-
texts.en:
Silvia, 23, is single and lives with her parents. Last year she finished her college degree in accounting. Silvia has had a shop, where she sells clothing, and costume and silver jewelry, for four years. She opened her business in the city's center when she started college. She rented a commercial space with help from her father, who gave her the initial capital. The business has grown, as she has applied her knowledge every day to help it prosper. 
She has applied for a loan to buy pants, blouses, t shirts, wallets, chains, bracelets, rings, and underwear to fill customer orders and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t shirts, wallets, chains, bracelets, rings, and underwear.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is training grounds for many of Kenya's Olympic runners. She has 2 children and has been doing agriculture work for 10 years. Her primary income sources are milk, crops, and personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "milking." Her biggest challenge is "climate change." Animals on the farm have been given the names of "koroiit."

Ann was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied that the first loan she took was profitable. This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "savings is important." Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan will benefit her family, Ann replied "educate children."
