As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Ann owns cow, poultry, and motorcycle; but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net and solar power, but does not have electricity, running water, sewing machine, TV, or DVD player.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit lives in the village of Haghartsin which is in Tavush region. She is not married and she lives with her retired parents in a nice house. Lilit graduated from Yerevan State University Ijevan branch, Faculty of Philology. For nearly thirteen years now, she has been working  at her village school as deputy director of education. Lilit says that she has rightly chosen her profession, since she loves children and she enjoys her work with them. 

Since Lilit is the only child of her parents, she feels great responsibility to take care of them properly, so simultaneously with her work she is engaged in farming. She has two calves and a cow, two piglets and twenty chickens in her farm. Her parents help her a lot with the farming. They manage to sell milk and eggs and sometimes meat also, to their villagers or city people. The income from farming has given them a chance to buy some furniture for their house.
  
Lilit is asking for a loan in the amount of 800,000 Armenian drams to buy three bulls and a lot of fodder for her farm animals. She hopes very much that this support will be timely and useful for her family.

loans.use: To buy three bulls and a lot of fodder for her farm animals

loans.name: Emzar

texts.en:
Emzar is 59-year-old, living in small town called Kutaisi with his wife and a grown son. His wife stays home, taking care of her family. Emzar used to work in Law Enforcement Structures and has the pension from that institution. His son is a loader at the plumbing store and gets a small salary. Their total amount of monthly income is nearly $170, which is hardly enough to cover everyday expenses for a three-member family, 

So Emzar decided to start a business and increase the family income. As he lacks experience with the new business and does not qualify under income requirements, local credit providers rejected his loan request. It was approved under the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This loan program provides start-up and re-startup credits with reduced requirements for the rural poor who do not have access to many credit products, as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the amount he is asking for, Emzar will start up a car parts store in his town and purchase merchandise such as engine oil, headlights, etc.  He will offer the local drivers a wide assortment of products and work till late evening to sell many items. Emzar is very hard-working and the type of person who puts family first.

This credit will be a great support for the family. Emzar is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to start up a car parts store

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 61-year-old married man with seven children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is tea farming, alongside serving as a civil servant in order to earn extra income. Good father that he is, he desires to educate his children up to the University. Like most farmers he is challenged by unpredictable weather changes and price fluctuation while his dream is to become a model farmer in the region.

George intends to use the loan to plant more tea.

loans.use: to plant more tea.

loans.name: Erisa

texts.en:
From Kyenjojo, Uganda, Erisa is a 34-year-old married man with three children. He has had a retail shop for eight years and also earns money farming.

Erisa opened his shop with 70,000 UGX and now has 7,000,000 UGX in working capital. He is applying for a 1,500,000 UGX loan through HOFOKAM to buy soda to sell in his shop.

Despite facing the hardship of price fluctuations, Erisa is determined to convert his business into a wholesale business and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy soda to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en:
Vardan, together with his parents and brother, lives in Gavar city, which is in the Gegharkunik region. He is 32 years old. After having passed his military service, for several years he went to the Russian Federation and was doing construction work there. Eight years ago he came back with some saved money, and together with his father and brother, established a small farm and became skilled in agriculture. They keep two cows, three calves and twenty chickens on their farm, but their agricultural activities are on a higher level and they have more income from it. They cultivate potatoes, beans, onions and cabbage. They cultivate these vegetables with great care; they do soil molding, choose the best seedlings and do watering work on time. They also have sweet and the best sort of apple and pear trees.  Vardan sells his farm products (vegetables, fruits, milk and eggs) at the Ijevan wholesale markets through re-sellers or his loyal customers.

Vardan has decided to develop his farming activities and he needs a great support; he wants to buy two cows, a piglet and a lot of animal fodder. He says that if he manages to have the same success from this as he has had from land cultivating, very soon he will think about getting married, as he will fully be able to take care of his own family as well.

loans.use: To buy two cows, a piglet and a lot of animal fodder

loans.name: Villa Industrial 2 Group

texts.es:
El Comité Villa Industrial 2 está en su ciclo número 2do. del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde  9 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con ingresos muy bajos, pero se encuentran luchando por salir y mejorar sus vidas.
Facunda es una persona muy trabajadora, que lucha y está esforzándose por salir adelante y poder ayudar a su familia. Ella cuenta con un comedor en donde deleita a sus clientes con todo tipo de platillos muy ricos, y con ellos tiene los ingresos para ir mejorando su vida.
Solicita de este crédito para poder comprar insumos para seguir haciendo alimentos y deleitar a sus clientes. Quiere comprar verduras, condimentos, pollo y demás insumos.
texts.en:
The Villa Industrial 2 committee is in its second cycle in the women's program committee, where everyone works and helps each other to come out ahead. They are doing the survey of poverty elimination, where 9 members find themselves below the poverty line, that is to say, with very low income, but they are fighting to get out of poverty and improve their lives.

Facunda is a very hard worker who struggles and who is making an effort to get ahead and to help her family. She has a dining room where she attracts her customers with all types of delicious dishes and with them she has the income to continue improving her life.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy supplies to continue making food and attracting her customers.  She wants to buy vegetables, condiments, chicken and other supplies.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, chicken and other supplies.

loans.name: Sensacion Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Sensacion está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están trabajando las 15 señoras para la eliminación de pobreza desde ahora y por medio de la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza.
Lucia es una persona que va a emprender en las ventas por medio de este crédito, el cual solicita para poder comprar bijouterie, lencería y demás artículos de mercería. Ella tiene la esperanza de poder ayudar a su familia por medio de su trabajo. Agradecen por esta oportunidad que están recibiendo ya que de esa forma podrán ayudar a sus familias.
texts.en:
The group Sensacion is in its 1st loan cycle of the women's communal bank programme and they are helping themselves to suceed. The 15 women are working to eliminate poverty in future by means of the poverty elimination survey.

Lucia is someone that will embark on sales by means of this loan, which she is requesting in order to buy jewelry, lingerie and other merchandise. She hopes to be able to support her family through her work.

She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving as in this way she will be able to help her family.

loans.use: to buy jewelry, lingerie and other merchandise

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya. She has four children and has been doing this work for 12 years. Her primary income sources are milk and eggs.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'milking.'  Her biggest challenge is 'Waiting for payments after delivering milk to coolers.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'JUHUDI.'

Rebecca was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'it works well with farmers.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: It empowers low-income earners.' 

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit her family', Rebecca replied, 'increase income.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Rebecca owns the following: 'cow, poultry, bicycle' but does not own 'pig, pump, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, solar power' but does not have 'electricity, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 40 years old and lives in Sanniquelle, the capital City of Nimba County. Sanniquelle is rich in natural resources, and living conditions there are much better than in the capital city of Liberia. It is the second largest populated county in Liberia. Nancy completed 12th grade, and she has four children between 24 and 14 years old; only three are presently attending school. She and her fiancee are living together. 

She started her business with money given to her by her brother; for the past twenty years now she has been running a table which sells rice, pepper, palm oil, vita (a drink), onion, season oil, etc. She spends 9 hours a day on her business. A problem she faces is a small income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, palm oil, vita, onion, season oil, etc. for her business. Her plan is to one day own a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, palm oil, vita, onion, season oil, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Enis Aleida

texts.es:
Enis es una joven de 26 años de edad, madre de cuatro hijos, esta acompañada. Ella con mucho sacrificio va saliendo adelante y a pesar de ser joven tiene un bonito negocio, una tienda bien establecida, administrada por ella misma. Aprendió el negocio, desde su niñez en la tienda de la vecina y le motivo esa actividad hasta lograr establecer su propio negocio posee una amplia experiencia, por lo cual su negocio va prosperando rápida mente, sus hijos tienen  8, 10 y 12 años respectivamente, son quienes le impulsan a mejorar cada día. 


Ella manifiesta que con su negocio puede solventar algunos gastos como: agua, luz, educación de sus hijos, pero presentan deficiencias en otros  como por ejemplo la siembra de cultivos. Por ese motivo, esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar 6 sacos de fertilizante y 2 galones de herbicidas, preparar el terreno donde sembrara el maíz.

La necesidad satisfecha será, la oportunidad de diversificar sus ingresos y poder tener lo necesario para su vivir, también poder realizar los proyectos que poseen y que sus hijos comprendan el costo  de las cosas y valoren lo que poseen.

Ella comenta, que ya no habrá necesidad de pensar como se van obtener los recursos; sino que solamente será de invertirlos, administrarlos de la mejor manera para que den resultados. 

En el periodo de trabajo junto a su compañero de vida, han pasado grandes dificultades y que su esfuerzo va orientado a que sus hijos tengan derecho a todo lo que se les limito a ellos (buena educación, alimentación, salud, etc.) por lo que su lucha será permanente para lograr alcanzar sus propósitos.
texts.en:
Enis is a 26-year-old young woman and the mother of four children; she is in a relationship. Through much sacrifice, she is moving forward, and despite being young, she has a nice business, a well-established store, which she manages herself. She learned this business as a child in her neighbor’s store; this activity motivated her so much that she started her own business. She has a lot of experience, so her business is quickly prospering. Her children are 8, 10, and 12 years old, and they are what motivates her to improve every day.
 She states that with her business she is able to cover some expenses such as water, electricity, and her children’s education, but she is not able to cover others, such as the planting of crops. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from the Fundación Campo to buy 6 sacks of fertilizer and 2 gallons of herbicide to prepare the land where she will plant corn.
If this need is covered, she will have the opportunity to diversify her income and will be able to have everything necessary to live. She will also be able to carry out her projects and help her children to understand the cost of things and to value what they have.
She says that she will no longer be any need to think about how she will obtain the resources [she needs]; she will only have to invest them and manage them in the best way so that they show results.
Since she has been working with her life partner, they have encountered many difficulties. They are making such an effort so that their children can have everything that was limited to Enis and her partner (a good education, a good diet, good health, etc.) They will continue to strive so that they can achieve their goals.

loans.use: to buy 6 sacks of fertilizer and 2 gallons of herbicide to prepare the land where she will plant corn.

loans.name: Sarina

texts.en:
Sarina is 23 years old and lives in Sanniquille, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources. Living conditions there are much better than in the capital city of Liberia, and it is the second most populated county in Liberia. 

Sarina completed grade 12, and she has a three-year-old child who is presently attending school. She and her fiancee are living together. She started her business from her mother. Selling her farm products (cassava, sweet potatoes, yams, etc.), she was able to establish her business; for three years by running a table where she sells rice, palm oil, Vita, peppers, etc. She  spends 8 hours on her business. 

A problem she faces is too little income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, palm oil, Vita, peppers,  etc., for her business. Her plan is to send her children to vocational school one day.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, palm oil, Vita, peppers, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Álvaro

texts.es:
Álvaro,  a sus 65 años de edad se dedica a la elaboración de arepas de maíz, para luego venderlas; actividad que realiza hace aproximadamente 15 años, luego de haber adquirido la experiencia cuando trabajaba en diversos restaurantes de la región. Él vive en compañía de su esposa en unión libre y no tiene hijos, por lo que sólo cuenta con el apoyo de ella. Álvaro se levanta en horas de la madrugada para comenzar a elaborar sus arepas de forma artesanal, pues muele el maíz a mano, luego de moldear las arepas, estas son asadas al carbón y, en horas de la tarde sale con su esposa a distribuirlas por toda  la zona, con lo cual obtiene los ingresos para subsistir diariamente.
El crédito que solicita desea invertirlo en la compra de un molino eléctrico $1.000.000, ollas para cocinar el maíz $300.000 y comprar maíz al por mayor $700.000, con lo cual podrá aumentar su producción ya que ahorraría tiempo al momento de moler el maíz y así podría utilizar este tiempo adicional en la distribución del producto hacia otras regiones cercanas, lo que le permitirá aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida con una buena estabilidad económica. Álvaro sueña con posicionar  su producto como un alimento 100% natural, que sea reconocido en toda la región y así poder generar más oportunidades de empleo.
texts.en:
Álvaro, 65, has been making and selling corn flatbread, a skill he acquired working in various local restaurants, for 15 years. He lives in a free union with his wife and has no children; therefore, he only has his wife's support. Álvaro gets up at dawn to make his homemade flatbread. He grinds the corn by hand, shapes and then grills the bread over wood, and goes out in the afternoon with his wife to sell the products throughout the neighborhood. The income allows them to support themselves each day. 

He has applied for a loan to buy an electric mill ($1000), pots to cook corn ($300), and wholesale corn ($700) to increase production. He will save time grinding the corn and will use the extra time to sell his product in other nearby neighborhoods. This will allow him to increase his income and improve his standard of living and finances. Álvaro dreams of marketing his product as 100% natural and having it be recognized throughout the area so that he can create more jobs.

loans.use: to buy an electric mill ($1000), pots to cook corn ($300), and wholesale corn ($700).

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Akossiwa vit avec son mari et leur enfant de 06ans à Lomé. Âgée de 31ans, elle revend des produits de mercerie dans une boutique depuis 2010 et s'y plait car cela lui procure des revenus lui permettant de contribuer au besoin de la famille. Son second prêt lui servira de s'approvisionner en marchandises afin de mieux répondre aux besoins de clients. Comme perspectives d'avenir, elle espère améliorer le niveau de l'activité et assurer l’épanouissent de la famille.
texts.en:
Akossiwa lives with her husband and their six-year-old in Lomé. Now 31 years old, Akossiwa has been selling notions from a shop since 2010 and enjoys doing so, since her sales bring in profits that allow her to contribute to the needs of the family.

Her second loan will allow Akossiwa to purchase supplies in order to better meet the needs of her customers. In the future, she hopes to increase her sales and ensure that her family thrives.

loans.use: To purchase notions.
